video_title: .NET에서 테스트를 위해 데이터베이스를 재설정하는 가장 좋은 방법
author: @Reverence1337
comment:
What I do is at the beginning of the integration test suite run a database is created and seeded in MSSQLLocalDB and a snapshot is taken, then each test class restores the database to the snapshot, runs its tests against it, then tears it down. The solution limits the number of total databases that can be spun up. I find it to be pretty quick and allows tests classes to be run in parallel which is helpful becase we have 1000+ integration tests.

However, if I didn't need parallelism and was looking for an easy to implement solution, Respawn definitely seems like a good option. Thanks for the info!

author: Uploader(Desc)
comment:
In this tutorial you are going to learn how to write an integration test in Spring Boot using Testcontainers. We are going to use Testcontainers to spin up a PostgreSQL database in a container and use that for our tests. We will write a Repository test and a Controller test that calls the repository that talks to our database.

video_title: .NET에서 통합 테스트를 위해 Docker를 사용하는 가장 좋은 방법
author: Uploader(Desc)
comment:
Get the source code for this video for FREE → https://the-dotnet-weekly.ck.page/tes...
☄️ Master the Modular Monolith Architecture: https://bit.ly/3SXlzSt
📌 Accelerate your Clean Architecture skills: https://bit.ly/3PupkOJ
🚀 Support me on Patreon to access the source code:   / milanjovanovic  

Integration testing is a testing approach that tests the integration between multiple components. Usually, this will involve a database, so you can test your query logic. Docker is an excellent tool for creating throwaway databases for your integration tests. And you can make it even better with the Testconatiners library. It allows you to programmatically create your docker containers for integration testing.

Testcontainers - Integration Testing Using Docker In .NET
https://www.milanjovanovic.tech/blog/...

Join my weekly .NET newsletter:
https://www.milanjovanovic.tech

Read my Blog here:
https://www.milanjovanovic.tech/blog

Subscribe for more:
   / @milanjovanovictech  

Chapters:
0:00 Creating the test project and installing Testcontainers
1:55 Implementing a custom WebApplicationFactory
6:11 Adding a PostgreSQL container with Testcontainers
8:15 Creating the base integration test class
9:57 Integration test 1: Creating a product with exception
13:10 Integration test 2: Creating a product and validating in the database
16:13 Integration test 3: Getting a product by the ID

video_title: 더 나은 통합 테스트를 위한 Testcontainers 마스터하기
author: Uploader(Desc)
comment:
Testcontainers libraries are a great way to create a reliable environment for running tests. They provide programmable, lightweight, and disposable containers to give you more confidence in your integration tests.

Getting started with Testcontainers is straightforward, but there are many advanced features to supercharge your test suite.

In this session, we’ll look at Testcontainers in more detail and answer the following questions:

What’s the best way to debug what happens in a container?
How do we build more complex topologies of services?
What’s the best way to migrate from Docker Compose?
How can we use Testcontainers for local development in addition to integration tests?
What is reusable mode and why is everyone talking about it?
Whether you’re a practitioner with solid test coverage or just beginning your journey into writing more reliable software, this session will introduce you to Testcontainers and its capabilities!

#Testcontainers #Docker #Java #SpringBoot

video_title: ASP.NET Core에서의 기능 테스트를 위한 완벽한 가이드(엔드투엔드 테스트)
author: Uploader(Desc)
comment:
☄️ Master the Modular Monolith Architecture: https://bit.ly/3SXlzSt
📌 Accelerate your Clean Architecture skills: https://bit.ly/3PupkOJ
🚀 Support me on Patreon to access the source code:   / milanjovanovicc  

Functional testing is a testing approach that tests your system functionality from a client's perspective. It's also called End-to-End (E2E) testing. In a typical ASP.NET Core APi, functional testing involves calling the API endpoints. You also want to use real external service to make your tests mimic a production environment. Docker is an excellent tool for creating throwaway databases for your functional tests. And you can make it even better with the Testconatiners library. It allows you to create throwaway docker containers for functional testing. I'll show you how to implement functional testing in this video.

Check out my courses: https://bit.ly/3PupkOJ

Testcontainers - Integration Testing Using Docker In .NET
https://www.milanjovanovic.tech/blog/...

Join my weekly .NET newsletter:
https://www.milanjovanovic.tech

Read my Blog here:
https://www.milanjovanovic.tech/blog

1:46 Installing TestContainers and Testing packages
2:30 Creating a custom WebApplicationFactory
6:08 Class fixture to share context between tests
6:56 Writing Functional Tests in ASP.NET Core

video_title: JUnit 5 및 Spring Boot를 사용한 테스트 컨테이너 소개
author: Uploader(Desc)
comment:
Get started with Testcontainers to write integration tests for your Spring Boot application with ease.

This tutorial covers a first introduction to the Testcontainers library and how you can manage Docker containers with it. Furthermore, you'll learn how to integrate it into your Spring Boot application while using JUnit 5.

You can find additional information on Testcontainers here: https://rieckpil.de/?s=testcontainers

The source code is available on GitHub: https://github.com/rieckpil/blog-tuto...

» Want to become an expert for testing Spring Boot applications? Join the Testing Spring Boot Applications Masterclass: https://rieckpil.de/testing-spring-bo...

» Join the 14 Days Free Email Course on Testing Java Applications to Accelerate Your Testing Success: https://rieckpil.de/getting-started-w...

video_title: Spring Boot 테스트 - Testcontainers를 사용한 REST API 통합 테스트 | Crash Course
author: Uploader(Desc)
comment:
In this video tutorial, we will learn how to do Spring Boot application Integration Testing using Testcontainers.

Check out my Spring boot testing Udemy course: https://www.udemy.com/course/testing-...

First, we write Integration tests using a local MySQL database, and then we will address the problem with Testcontainers as a solution.

Chapters:
[04:03] What problem do Testcontainers solve
[06:17] Testcontainers overview
[09:37] Create Spring boot project
[13:16] Configure MySQL Database
[14:56] Create Student JPA entity
[17:56] Create Student JPA Repository
[18:58] Create StudentController and REST APIs
[22:31] Write Integration Test for REST API
[32:58] Run Integration Test
[33:51] What is the problem with Integration Test
[34:44] Adding Testcontainers
[37:21] Integration testing using Testcontainers
[44:52] Using Singleton containers pattern
[48:38] Run Integration Test

SpringBoot provides excellent support for integration testing using @SpringBootTest annotation.

Testcontainers is a Java library that supports JUnit tests, providing lightweight, throwaway instances of common databases, Selenium web browsers, or anything else that can run in a Docker container.

Testcontainer allows us to use Docker containers within our tests. As a result, we can write self-contained integration tests that depend on external resources.

Blog post: https://www.javaguides.net/2022/01/sp...

GitHub repository at https://github.com/RameshMF/springboo...

video_title: 엔비디아도 깜짝 놀랄 초거대 계산 반도체가  나옵니다 (KIST 초거대계산반도체전략연구단 구현철 단장)
author: Uploader(Desc)
comment:
본 영상은 국가과학기술연구회의 제작지원을 받았습니다

[AI가 영상을 요약한 내용입니다]
 
📌내용 요약
 국가과학기술연구회와 언더스탠딩이 공동으로 진행하는 과학 대중화 프로젝트 첫 번째 편에서는 초거대 계산 반도체 전략 연구단 구현철 박사가 '초거대 계산 반도체'에 대해 설명했습니다.
 기존 CPU와 GPU의 연산 방식(순차적, 병렬적 계산)으로는 복잡한 조합 최적화 문제를 해결하는 데 한계가 있으며, 이에 대응하기 위해 '랜덤 컴퓨팅(확률적 컴퓨팅)'이라는 새로운 접근이 필요하다고 강조합니다. 랜덤 컴퓨팅은 진정한 난수 발생을 기반으로, 문제의 정답을 직접 찾기보다는 정답일 가능성이 높은 후보군을 빠르게 제시하는 방식입니다. 이를 위해 자연계 기반 난수 발생 장치와 새로운 형태의 반도체 칩 개발이 진행되고 있습니다. 이 기술은 신약 개발, 기후 예측, 물류 최적화 등 고차원적 문제 해결에 적용될 수 있으며, 양자 컴퓨터와 비교해 상온 동작, 기존 반도체 공정 활용 등의 장점이 있다고 설명했습니다.

🔑핵심 주제
CPU·GPU 방식의 한계: 기존 컴퓨팅 방식으로는 조합 최적화 문제를 풀기에 계산량과 비용이 과다하게 발생함.
랜덤 컴퓨팅의 개념: 난수를 기반으로 정답 후보를 확률적으로 빠르게 도출하는 새로운 연산 방법.
진정한 난수 발생의 중요성: 편향 없는 난수 발생이 정확한 결과 도출의 핵심이며, 자연계 현상 활용 필요.
초거대 계산 반도체 개발 목표: 특정 문제를 효율적으로 풀기 위한 전용 칩 개발 중, 5년 내 실용화 목표.
응용 가능성: 신약 개발, 기후 예측, 물류 최적화, 금융시장 예측 등 고난이도 문제 해결에 활용 기대

어떤 문제로 최대생산을 못하는지 원인을 알고 싶지않나요?
최대 생산을 위해서는 어떤 문제를 해결해야 하는지 궁금하지 않나요?

저희가 자체 개발 보유한 3D엔진 원천기술을 활용한 시뮬레이터 솔루션의 아래 기능으로 해결해드립니다.

1. 설비 자동배치(최단 물류거리, 최대 통합배치율 기반)  기능
2. 레이아웃 최적화 검증 3D시뮬레이터
3. 생산성(Capa.) 및 물류 최적화 예측 및 검증 3D시뮬레이터
4. 실시간 대시보드 및 결과 보고서 (공장 시간/일/주/월 생산량, 병목 자동 검지, 공정밸런스, 공정/설비 가동률, 창고(버퍼, 랙) WIP 등)
5. 최적 레이아웃 도면 자동 설계 및 출력

"TCS 탑코어시스템" 으로 검색하시면 다른 솔루션 제품 영상도 많습니다^^

comment: For those getting the error 404 axios error. I solved it by first make sure the api.js and the .env are in the same directory. I didnt. To make sure that the error really is about not reading the .env you can replace the import in "baseURL: import.meta.env.VITE_API_URL ? import.meta.env.VITE_API_URL : apiUrl" to the env variable and it should work

video_title: Appwrite와 함께하는 풀스택 React 개발자 과정
author: Uploader(Desc)
comment:
In this React course, you'll not only learn the nuances of React and its internal workings but also immerse yourself in building a variety of projects to understand the practical applications of React features. This course uniquely balances a project-focused approach with comprehensive theoretical knowledge, ensuring a thorough understanding of each concept. By the end of this course, not only will you have a bunch of projects for your portfolio, but you'll also gain hands-on experience in creating a full-stack application using Appwrite, integrating advanced tools like Redux-Toolkit and Tailwind to craft production-grade applications.

💻 Code: https://github.com/hiteshchoudhary/re...

✏️ Course created by ‪@HiteshCodeLab‬ 

❤️ Try interactive Full Stack courses we love, right in your browser: https://scrimba.com/freeCodeCamp-Full... (Made possible by a grant from our friends at Scrimba)

⭐️ Contents ⭐️
⌨️ (00:00:00) React Roadmap
⌨️ (00:20:05) Create react projects
⌨️ (00:42:37) Understand the react flow and structure
⌨️ (01:09:15) Create your own react library and JSX
⌨️ (01:40:45) Why you need hooks and project
⌨️ (02:00:12) Virtual DOM, Fibre and reconciliation
⌨️ (02:13:55) Tailwind and Props in reactjs

⌨️ (02:58:20) useEffect, useRef and useCallback with 1 project
⌨️ (03:38:37) Custom hooks in react . currency Project

⌨️ (06:25:21) Context API with local Storage
⌨️ (07:33:39) Building a full stack project with react and appwrite
⌨️ (07:40:51) Exploring the new docs of appwrite

Artificial intelligence can be used to Ring up items whether they were brought up to the register or items in a person's pocket that was taken off a shelf , And artificial intelligence can be hooked directly to the security system/ camera system and accurately determine if a person was stealing, and Artificial intelligence could notify the police if the person does not pay for the items when they get to the register or self-checkout. Also the robots don't discriminate as humans often believe certain types of people are stealing as soon as they come into the store or that those people are planning to steal artificial intelligence won't do that which means there will be much less false police reports and false accusations put on people especially minorities. Also people won't have so many limitations on shopping like not being allowed to come in a store with a bag, because artificial intelligence will be watching diligently. This also ends altercations occur because of poor customer service or even if the customer service person was correct they still can't argue and fight with other humans. Stores are Robbed and vandalized because of poor customer service and discrimination by other humans. Also a robot is indifferent to a person calling it names or telling it to hurry up it just does its function unlike a human who will be angered or do something irrational. Artificial intelligence will also save business owners money so that they don't have to hire so many employees especially of these robots are programmed to be diligent workers. Customer service officials in stores are not elevating the human life to a beneficial degree or making some good contribution to society as a whole they are actually part of the problem that contribute to the degradation of humanity. And they could get jobs that contribute more to helping the human society become better and more advanced and more comfortable. author: @Wallstreetpaper
comment: Loved the breakdown of “how to be hardcore.” Not productivity hacks, just deep, obsessive care. Simple but underrated.

video_title: Alexandr Wang: Building Scale AI, Transforming Work With Agents & Competing With China
author: @Hall
comment:
Here are some tips for entrepreneurs:

• Focus on problems: Early on, Scale AI focused on the narrow problem of self-driving cars (8:19).
• Be aware of market size: Focusing on self-driving cars enabled quick scaling, but wasn't a large enough market to sustain a gigantic business (9:51).
• Generate data for AI applications: To be successful in any vertical area, AI needs data, so demand for those products would precede the evolution of AI into those industries ().
• Find repetitive human workflows: Identify repetitive human workflows and convert that into data sets that enable building automation tools ().
• Care: The biggest thing is you just have to really, really, really care ().

video_title: The Future of Work: High-Paying Careers That AI Won't Replace
author: @alex-cu1tz
comment:
I don’t really agree with this. I’ve talked to around 300 people working in tech, and the reality is that big companies like Microsoft, Google, Amazon, and Meta are still doing layoffs. The market is really unstable, and landing a job now is much harder than before.
There might be more roles in AI, like machine learning engineers, but overall, competition is extremely high across the entire tech industry. Everyone is fighting for fewer positions, and the interview processes have become super tough.
So yeah, while AI may be shifting the job landscape, it’s definitely not making it easier to get hired.

video_title: The Future of Work: High-Paying Careers That AI Won't Replace
author: @TiSIWO
comment: They are not hiring ppl. They are adjusting skill set, now that the mission is getting clearer. A Theoretical Physicist may be deeply involved in the early stages of a project’s R&D when it was a Scientific problem, but as key issues are fully identified and slowly being resolved, the nature of the problem is slowly becoming an Engineering problem, an an Applied Physicist may be in higher demand. So. Google, Meta, Anthropic, etc are adjusting their skill pools. Be careful.

100k???
No thx…
I have a job and freedom (I work where- and whenever I want ;)))

* Which type of work cannot be replaced by AI and is the best-paid???

AI strategist-philosopher (a “Renaissance Man”), because this person sets the direction and implements the entire transformation in the world (holistically: culture, science, mentoring, etc.).

How much would they earn?

I estimate up to 10 billion/ year.
But there is also a paradox- such change takes a lot of time, so it becomes an auction (“the pioneer’s advantage”; we currently have a “blue ocean theory,” meaning that whoever “positions themselves correctly” at the beginning will be setting the rules for the next 50- 100 years, just like it was with BMW/ Mercedes/ Siemens/ etc.).

video_title: 스크린샷을 사용하여 수동 테스트 케이스를 자동으로 생성하는 방법 | Testcase Studio
author: Uploader(Desc)
comment:
Testcase Studio는 Sanjay Kumar가 개발한 혁신적인 확장 기능으로, 테스트 케이스 자동 생성 프로세스를 간소화합니다. 고급 기능을 통해 사용자 단계를 자동으로 기록하여 수동으로 테스트 케이스를 생성할 필요가 없습니다. 수동 테스터든 자동화 테스터든 테스트 케이스를 작성하게 됩니다.

테스트 케이스 작성은 시간이 많이 소요되는 작업입니다. 하지만 Testcase Studio는 코딩 지식이 전혀 필요하지 않습니다. Testcase Studio는 사용자의 작업을 기록하고, 필요한 단계를 지능적으로 캡처하여 스크린샷과 함께 완벽하게 작동하는 테스트 케이스로 변환합니다.

이러한 단계를 활용하여 버그를 제기하는 동안에도 테스트 케이스를 제작할 수 있습니다. 이를 통해 테스터와 개발자 간의 효율적인 소통이 가능해져 버그 해결 속도가 향상됩니다.

Testcase Studio를 사용하면 귀중한 시간을 절약하고 전반적인 생산성을 향상시킬 수 있습니다.

다운로드 링크 -

무케시 오트와니와 테스트 자동화 소개:
안녕하세요, 저는 인도 방갈로르라는 활기찬 도시에서 열정적으로 활동하는 전문가 무케시 오트와니입니다. 이 채널은 수동 테스터와 QA 전문가 지망생들이 자동화 테스트 세계로 순조롭게 진입할 수 있도록 돕는 데 전념하고 있습니다. 수년간의 실무 경험을 바탕으로 Selenium WebDriver, TestNG, Maven, Appium, Sikuli, AutoIT, Jenkins, Git, GitHub, RPA, Playwright 등 다양한 도구와 기술을 다루는 실용적이고 초보자 친화적인 튜토리얼을 공유합니다. 자동화 여정을 시작하거나 실제 프로젝트에서 얻은 통찰력과 프레임워크 개발을 통해 역량을 향상시키고자 하시는 분이라면, 이 채널이 바로 정답입니다. 구독하고 자동화를 완벽하게 익히고 끊임없이 진화하는 기술 산업에서 앞서 나가기 위해 노력하는 학습자 커뮤니티에 참여하세요.

video_title: Embrace: Modern mobile observability built on OpenTelemetry
author: Uploader(Desc)
comment:
“What’s up with the mobile app?” For many engineering teams, this is a dreaded question—exposing gaps in visibility between backend and mobile teams.

Backend engineers focus on server health, while mobile engineers are often in a silo, lacking the right tools to diagnose complex issues. Communication becomes a barrage of notifications with no unified view of the problem. Mobile has been the missing piece—until now.

Meet Embrace.
✅ Open-source SDKs for mobile observability
✅ Enriched data & powerful analysis dashboards
✅ Built on OpenTelemetry for complete data portability
✅ Captures crashes, errors, memory issues & full user sessions

🔎 See Embrace in action:
1️⃣ A backend engineer spots checkout latency in Grafana (or any backend).
2️⃣ They identify that the mobile workflow is slowing down.
3️⃣ Mobile engineers use Embrace to dive into the session timeline and find the culprit.
4️⃣ The team fixes it fast—boosting app performance and user satisfaction.

It’s time to elevate user experiences and modernize observability with Embrace. Let’s embrace the future of real user monitoring together.

Learn more: https://embrace.io/

video_title: JavaScript 테스트 소개 튜토리얼 - 단위 테스트, 통합 테스트 및 e2e 테스트
author: @jonaskromwell4464
comment:
Best unit testing from the ground up I've seen so far on all the world wide interwebs! Been paying for tutorials, searching high and low... Thanks for putting this together beginning with testing a most BASIC function that returns only a string concatenated value. This is what I've been looking for!!!

The one thing I don't see anyone doing (neither professionally nor in any demonstration) is to combine debugging with unit testing functions. My biggest benefit to TDD is to setup the expectation prior to writing the function and write the function to satisfy that. That way, I am testing mostly functions only and, by the time it's completed to satisfaction, the test enforces the outputs from the function. The test is done and the function is done. I do not understand why more developers do not work this way.

video_title: Let AI Explore Your Site & Write Tests with Playwright MCP!
author: Uploader(Desc)
comment:
What if your tests could write themselves by actually using your app like a real user?
In this video, we demo the Playwright MCP (Model Context Protocol) in action, using Agent Mode to explore a website, detect features, and generate meaningful end-to-end tests automatically.

🧪 What you'll see:

Running the MCP server locally in VS Code
Generating real tests through autonomous exploration
Discovering edge cases (yes, even bugs!)
Writing & running tests with zero manual scripting
Reviewing results in the Trace Viewer

Perfect for devs who want to accelerate test coverage, catch unexpected behavior, and leverage AI-powered testing with Playwright.

👉 Try it yourself and see what your app has been hiding from you!
Check out the blog post for detailed explanation and prompt file: https://dev.to/debs_obrien/letting-pl...

#Playwright #MCP #ModelContextProtocol #AITesting #TestAutomation #EndToEndTesting #DeveloperTools

video_title: AI-Driven Test Automation with Playwright + Cursor + MCP Server
author: Uploader(Desc)
comment:
In this tutorial, we show QA engineers and developers how to build a complete Playwright test automation framework in Python using AI. We integrate the Playwright Model Context Protocol (MCP) Server with Cursor IDE to generate a full framework (using the Page Object Model design pattern for maintainable, scalable test code) entirely through an AI prompt – no manual coding required. You’ll see how to go from initial setup to running real browser tests in one seamless flow, using AI to speed up development.

Repositories:

MCP Server: https://github.com/executeautomation/...
Where you can find my instructions, and my prompt: https://github.com/JoanEsquivel/playw...


#testing #playwright #automation #python #javascript #typescript #mcpserver #cursor #agents

video_title: Flask + React 프로젝트 생성 방법 | Python 백엔드 + React 프런트엔드
author: Uploader(Desc)
comment:
Hey guys, welcome back. In this video, I will show you guys how to set up a project with a Flask backend and a React frontend. We will set up a backend API with Python that returns an array of members and in the frontend, we will fetch that backend and display the same members onto the frontend.

If you don't know what Flask is, Flask is a Python-based web framework that is used to create web applications. It is a microframework, which means that it does not provide many of the features that larger frameworks do. Flask is designed to be extended and customized, and it can be used for web development in both production and development environments.

If you don't know what React is, React is a JavaScript library for building user interfaces. It is maintained by Facebook and Instagram. React's declarative, efficient, and flexible nature make it an ideal choice for building user interfaces.



Official Flask Documentation: https://flask.palletsprojects.com/en/...
Official React Documentation: https://reactjs.org/

comment: The most comprehensive explanation, I'm a new subscriber, I liked how simple and clear the roadmap was

video_title: The Complete Frontend Developer Roadmap
author: @raakgu
comment:
Really good video.

I highly recommend learning state management, Redux, MobX before learning react native.

And pick one framework like React and learn it so well you can land a job. There's plenty of jobs that look for each framework so choose one and master it rather than trying several.

Also, the extra time spent on deeply learning JavaScript would pay off more.

My stack is Next.js, React, JavaScript, CSS, Sass, Stylus and I've written my own CSS library.

React Native is awesome but it's a whole new learning curve beyond frontend development. I'd suggest learning it in the job or after work rather than before you ever land a job.

If you can do state management in React applications and handle data flow from the back-end and APIs you will get a job over anyone who cannot. All big companies need you to understand state or you won't be very useful.

Learn design patterns in React and JavaScript.

video_title: System Design: TINDER as a microservice architecture
author: Uploader(Desc)
comment:
다음 면접에서 좋은 결과를 얻고 싶으신가요? 이 시스템 설계 비디오 강좌를 수강해 보세요! 🔥
https://interviewready.io

틴더의 시스템 아키텍처를 설계합니다. 앱 설계는 시스템 요구 사항을 명확히 하는 것부터 시작됩니다. 면접에서 틴더는 여러 가지 요구 사항을 가지고 있습니다.

시스템을 설계할 때는 마이크로서비스 아키텍처를 기반으로 논리적 구성 요소를 도출하고 다른 서비스와의 상호 작용을 정의합니다. 내부 세부 사항은 시스템 설계 개념에 대한 사전 지식을 통해 처리할 수 있다고 가정합니다. 여기에는 부하 분산, 메시지 큐, 데이터베이스 등이 포함됩니다.

틴더 시스템은 프로필 저장, 추천, 매칭 기록, 매칭 상대와의 채팅이라는 네 가지 요구 사항을 가지고 있습니다. 프로필 저장은 이미지 저장을 제외하고는 간단하며, 이미지 저장에서는 BLOB와 파일 저장에 대한 논쟁이 있습니다. 이미지를 저장할 때는 분산 파일 아키텍처가 가장 적합합니다.

다이렉트 메시징이나 매칭 상대와의 채팅은 XMPP 프로토콜을 사용하여 수행할 수 있습니다. XMPP 프로토콜은 웹 소켓을 사용하여 클라이언트와 서버 간에 P2P 통신을 수행합니다. 각 연결은 TCP 기반으로 구축되어 연결이 유지됩니다. 세션 마이크로서비스는 사용자 매핑 연결을 기반으로 수신자에게 메시지를 전송할 수 있습니다.

저희 시스템은 최대한 분리되어 있습니다. 클라이언트에서 수락 및 거부 정보를 유지하려고 노력합니다. 왼쪽이나 오른쪽으로 스와이프할 때 클라이언트는 해당 동작을 기록하고 블룸 필터를 사용하여 동일한 사용자를 다시 표시하지 않을 수 있습니다.

서버에는 매치 마이크로서비스라는 검증 엔진이 있으며, 이 엔진은 매치를 기록하고 두 사용자 간의 채팅을 허용 또는 거부합니다.

추천의 마지막 요건은 사용자 데이터를 도시별로 분할하는 것입니다. 이는 Cassandra나 Amazon Dynamo와 같은 NoSQL 데이터베이스를 사용하여 구현됩니다. 다른 옵션은 수평 분할을 지원하는 관계형 데이터베이스를 사용하는 것입니다. 이 개념을 샤딩이라고 합니다.

의문점, 제안 또는 피드백이 있으시면 아래에 남겨주시기 바랍니다. 이 시스템은 아직 완벽하지는 않지만, 한 시간 분량의 인터뷰를 진행하기에는 충분합니다.

면책 조항: 본 영상에는 Tinder의 내부 구현이 포함되어 있지 않으며, 이를 암시하지도 않습니다. 저희가 디자인한 시스템은 순전히 상상의 산물일 뿐이며, 실제 앱과는 아무런 연관이 없습니다. 틴더 엔지니어들이 이보다 더 나은 시스템을 만들어냈을 거라고 확신합니다!

00:00 선행 학습
00:40 특징 선택
05:50 이미지 저장
12:30 시스템 설계
18:22 채팅용 다이렉트 메시징
23:45 매칭 알고리즘
27:16 추천 엔진
34:40 마무리 지침

video_title: .NET에서 테스트를 위해 데이터베이스를 재설정하는 가장 좋은 방법
author: @Reverence1337
comment:
What I do is at the beginning of the integration test suite run a database is created and seeded in MSSQLLocalDB and a snapshot is taken, then each test class restores the database to the snapshot, runs its tests against it, then tears it down. The solution limits the number of total databases that can be spun up. I find it to be pretty quick and allows tests classes to be run in parallel which is helpful becase we have 1000+ integration tests.

However, if I didn't need parallelism and was looking for an easy to implement solution, Respawn definitely seems like a good option. Thanks for the info!

video_title: .NET에서 테스트를 위해 데이터베이스를 재설정하는 가장 좋은 방법
author: @darwinzins
comment:
Nick says something like "it observes it, creates some sql and resets it back to a previous point" which would be fantastic, but the actual description from the github repo is "Respawn resets the database back to a clean, empty state by intelligently deleting data from tables."

Resetting back to a previous point and resetting back to a clean, EMPTY state are two very different things.

So does it actually reset back to a previous point or does it just empty the tables you tell it to empty?

video_title: .NET에서 테스트를 위해 데이터베이스를 재설정하는 가장 좋은 방법
author: @markmiretsky4229
comment: Hey Nick, great video! I don't reset my integ test database at all. What I do instead is I generate a unique test key (an integer) for each test. I do that using a special "TestExecution" table with an identity column. I insert a record into this table at the beginning of each test, then get the value of the identity column from the inserted record. Once I have a test key, I use it to construct names of my domain objects. For example, all tests that create a Customer object would use $"Test Customer {_testKey}" as the name. This avoids data collisions between tests and eliminates the need to reset the database after each test.

Integration testing is a testing approach that tests the integration between multiple components. Usually, this will involve a database, so you can test your query logic. Docker is an excellent tool for creating throwaway databases for your integration tests. And you can make it even better with the Testconatiners library. It allows you to programmatically create your docker containers for integration testing.

video_title: 더 나은 통합 테스트를 위한 Testcontainers 마스터하기
author: Uploader(Desc)
comment:
Testcontainers libraries are a great way to create a reliable environment for running tests. They provide programmable, lightweight, and disposable containers to give you more confidence in your integration tests.

Getting started with Testcontainers is straightforward, but there are many advanced features to supercharge your test suite.

In this session, we’ll look at Testcontainers in more detail and answer the following questions:

What’s the best way to debug what happens in a container?
How do we build more complex topologies of services?
What’s the best way to migrate from Docker Compose?
How can we use Testcontainers for local development in addition to integration tests?
What is reusable mode and why is everyone talking about it?
Whether you’re a practitioner with solid test coverage or just beginning your journey into writing more reliable software, this session will introduce you to Testcontainers and its capabilities!

#Testcontainers #Docker #Java #SpringBoot

video_title: TestContainers를 활용한 Spring Boot에서의 Kafka E2E 통합 테스트 마스터하기 | JavaTechie
author: Uploader(Desc)
comment:

video_title: Spring Boot 테스트 - Testcontainers를 사용한 REST API 통합 테스트 | Crash Course
author: Uploader(Desc)
comment:
In this video tutorial, we will learn how to do Spring Boot application Integration Testing using Testcontainers.

Check out my Spring boot testing Udemy course: https://www.udemy.com/course/testing-...

First, we write Integration tests using a local MySQL database, and then we will address the problem with Testcontainers as a solution.

Chapters:
[04:03] What problem do Testcontainers solve
[06:17] Testcontainers overview
[09:37] Create Spring boot project
[13:16] Configure MySQL Database
[14:56] Create Student JPA entity
[17:56] Create Student JPA Repository
[18:58] Create StudentController and REST APIs
[22:31] Write Integration Test for REST API
[32:58] Run Integration Test
[33:51] What is the problem with Integration Test
[34:44] Adding Testcontainers
[37:21] Integration testing using Testcontainers
[44:52] Using Singleton containers pattern
[48:38] Run Integration Test

SpringBoot provides excellent support for integration testing using @SpringBootTest annotation.

Testcontainers is a Java library that supports JUnit tests, providing lightweight, throwaway instances of common databases, Selenium web browsers, or anything else that can run in a Docker container.

Testcontainer allows us to use Docker containers within our tests. As a result, we can write self-contained integration tests that depend on external resources.

Blog post: https://www.javaguides.net/2022/01/sp...

GitHub repository at https://github.com/RameshMF/springboo...

video_title: Preventing Deep-Level Documentation in Spring REST Docs
author: Uploader(Desc)
comment:
Learn how to effectively manage deep-level documentation when using Spring REST Docs with the `@  RestdocsNotExpanded` annotation to keep your API documentation clean and concise.
---
This video is based on the question https://stackoverflow.com/q/65933191/ asked by the user 'alex_steward' ( https://stackoverflow.com/u/14104461/ ) and on the answer https://stackoverflow.com/a/66023306/ provided by the user 'alex_steward' ( https://stackoverflow.com/u/14104461/ ) at 'Stack Overflow' website. Thanks to these great users and Stackexchange community for their contributions.

Visit these links for original content and any more details, such as alternate solutions, latest updates/developments on topic, comments, revision history etc. For example, the original title of the Question was: Spring REST Docs +   RequestBody +   Prevent deep-level documentation of fields

Also, Content (except music) licensed under CC BY-SA https://meta.stackexchange.com/help/l...
The original Question post is licensed under the 'CC BY-SA 4.0' ( https://creativecommons.org/licenses/... ) license, and the original Answer post is licensed under the 'CC BY-SA 4.0' ( https://creativecommons.org/licenses/... ) license.

If anything seems off to you, please feel free to write me at vlogize [AT] gmail [DOT] com.
---
Preventing Deep-Level Documentation in Spring REST Docs

When developing with Spring, it's common to utilize tools like Spring REST Docs to create documentation for your REST APIs. However, one challenge developers face is the generation of excessively deep-level documentation for request bodies. This can lead to convoluted and hard-to-read documentation output, hindering the clarity and effectiveness of your API reference. In this guide, we’ll address this common problem and provide a solution that keeps your API documentation clean and easy to understand.

The Problem: Deep-Level Documentation Output

Consider the following Spring controller method designed to edit a resource:

[[See Video to Reveal this Text or Code Snippet]]

Such a method can lead to request body documentation resembling the following:

[[See Video to Reveal this Text or Code Snippet]]

This output can quickly become unwieldy, especially when dealing with nested objects. The documentation's deep nesting makes it difficult for consumers of your API to grasp the necessary information without wading through excessive details.

The Solution: Using @  RestdocsNotExpanded Annotation

Fortunately, Spring REST Docs provides a straightforward solution to this problem. By utilizing the @  RestdocsNotExpanded annotation, you can customize your documentation to prevent the propagation of deep-level field expansions. Here’s how you can implement it in your project:

Step 1: Annotate Your DTO Fields

For every field in your Data Transfer Object (DTO) that you want to keep at a shallow level, simply annotate it with @  RestdocsNotExpanded. Here's an example of how to structure your DTO:

[[See Video to Reveal this Text or Code Snippet]]

By applying @  RestdocsNotExpanded to the childs field, you effectively instruct Spring REST Docs not to delve deeper into its structure when generating documentation.

Step 2: Update Your Test Method for Documentation

In your test methods, you can continue to document your API as you normally would, without worrying about deep-level field expansions:

[[See Video to Reveal this Text or Code Snippet]]

This way, your output will remain concise and only reflect the level of detail that you want to expose, eliminating the nested child fields that can clutter your documentation.

Conclusion

Maintaining clarity and accessibility in your API documentation is crucial for its usability. By employing the @  RestdocsNotExpanded annotation, you can easily configure Spring REST Docs to prevent the deep-level documentation of nested fields in request bodies. This not only improves the readability of your documentation but also enhances the overall experience for developers interacting with your API. Happy documenting!

video_title: How to Start App Development? Complete RoadMap | 2024
author: @kumarharsh6329
comment: As an app developer with Java and flutter both, I would say this video is on point. Both the backend and frontend part are correct. Just one thing to add, in kotlin things like coroutines etc are important, you may skip using it in app(when you see online videos, they choose the easy path) but you must implement these things, there are many ways to pass data in flutter, but you must use the most effective one, and not just get done with the easy ones. Remember companies will ask you the efficient ones because no company will compromise on that. Always deploy your app on store, make the app not just like a project, but like an end user application keeping user experience in mind and fixing such bugs. Try to be great at ui look and feel, keep the api based backend secure and fast. 2 great projects on resume and well prepared for interviews will land you in a good company.

video_title: Redis Crash Course - Redis를 기본 데이터베이스로 사용하는 방법, 이유 및 내용
author: Uploader(Desc)
comment:
Redis Tutorial - the What, Why and How to use Redis as a primary database
►  Use this special link https://redis.info/NANA (or code: NANA200) to try Redis Enterprise Cloud to get a $200 credit, become part of a weekly raffle, and a chance to win a Tesla Model 3 🤩  (Terms and conditions apply)! 
►  This video is sponsored by Redis 🙌🏼

#redis #database #techworldwithnana

In this Redis crash course, we're going to talk about Redis and how Redis can be used as a primary database for complex applications that need to store data in multiple formats.
1) First we will see what Redis is and its usages as well as why it is suitable for modern complex
microservice applications. 
2) We will talk about how Redis supports storing multiple data formats for different purposes through its modules.
3) Next we will see how Redis as an in-memory database can persist data and recover from data loss.
4) We'll also talk about how Redis optimizes memory storage cost using Redis on Flash.
5) Then we will see very interesting use cases of scaling Redis and replicating it across multiple geographic regions and 
6) finally since one of the most popular platforms for running microservices is Kubernetes and since running stateful applications in Kubernetes is a bit challenging, we will see how you can easily run Redis on Kubernetes.


▬▬▬▬▬▬ T I M E S T A M P S ⏰  ▬▬▬▬▬▬
0:00 - Intro and Overview
1:13 - What is Redis?
1:42 - Use Cases & Benefits of a Multi-Model DB
4:58 - How Redis works? Redis Modules
6:49 - Data Persistence & Durability with Redis (Snapshotting and AOF)
11:14 - Saving Costs with Redis on Flash
12:34 - How to scale a Redis database?
16:41 - High Availability across multiple regions (Active-Active Geo Distribution)
20:23 - Running Redis in Kubernetes

author: @theycallmesloth
comment:
at 02:02:30

it is called tacit programming or point free function.

let G = x: F(x) 

let y = array.map(x => G(x))
we can do 
array.map(G)

it will 'capture' the arguments that the map HOF provides and pass it to G.

it will not work when lets say your callback takes 2 args. since G takes only 1 arg. For it to work, G must have 2 params.

video_title: 자율 AI 에이전트 - 왜 여러분이 만들어야 하는지... 그리고 어떻게 만들어야 하는지.
comment:
CORRECTIONS

I sometimes have to post corrections to videos, so I use pinned comments (this thing here) so people see it.

I got a lot of pushback on my comments about Python, so I do want to clarify what I mean:

For new people who are just starting to learn how to code, the whole process is daunting and the learning curve is steep. You have to figure out IF you need to learn to code, WHAT language to learn, WHICH dev tools to use, college or online... the list goes on and on.

I think this stops a lot of people just due to decision fatigue alone.

My goal was to make it so simple that people would be kicked into action. Just "LEARN PYTHON. USE GOOGLE COLLAB".


Once people start coding and building useful applications, then can start expanding their knowledge, add other languages etc. The learning process is addicting and will carry them further.

Only 0.5% of the world can code!

We need to get more people to start learning to do it.

So for people just starting to code and interested in AI:
JUST LEARN PYTHON

(that's step 1, don't worry about the rest of the road yet)

author: @michaeleinstein7097
comment:
I had a very interesting time using GPT to simulate a brainstorming session with two chatbots, A and B. I started by choosing a topic, and then I asked A and B to come up with ideas for improvement. Both chatbots generated ideas, and then I asked them each what they thought about the other's idea. Finally, I asked A and B to consider each other's ideas and come up with a new idea by fusing the two together.

The outcome was amazing. This is the future of brainstorming! You can even instruct the chatbots to be experts in different fields, such as A being a teacher and B being an engineer. The more creative you make them, the better the outcome will be.

video_title: 자율 AI 에이전트 - 왜 여러분이 만들어야 하는지... 그리고 어떻게 만들어야 하는지.
author: @Yewbzee
comment:
Prompt engineering is a massive aspect and key to success on GPT. I have spent a lot of hours coding with it so far and it is both amazing and frustrating as hell sometimes.

You’re prompts totally dictate the IQ level of the conversation. I’ve seen this many times where I start a coding project on GPT 4 and it’s totally in sync with what I want and it’s code output and brainstorming are top notch. After a couple of hours in the project conversation all that can go totally off track and it’s as though GPT 4 decided to take a break and it’s dumb brother got behind the wheel instead as it starts failing to understand the simplest of prompts. I’ve found at that point it’s best to gather what you’ve got so far and start a new conversation.

author: @johnderperez
comment: This is pretty cool... but here's a thought.  If we're using AI to do some task 'better,' it means whatever that task is (ordering pizza, booking a trip, etc.) the processed sucked to begin with.  When companies figure this out, wouldn't they escalate their experiences, perhaps build in their own AI functionalities, to make performing such a task 'better' than what it is now?  These AI agents are great... but just a layer between a human doing a task, and a currently existing platform or platforms that kinda suck at the process/system of doing such task.

author: @tchristell
comment: Interesting that one of the challenges for robotics is working with the physical world that evolved because of human anatomy e.g. door knobs, stairs. The current challenge is the UI that evolved around the same paradigm e.g. keyboards, mice and screens. At some point is there is going to be a state change when the predominate environment will be primarily digital? -- AI will feel perfectly comfortable and humans will be the ones struggling to adapt.

video_title: OpenAI의 새로운 성명 "모든 것이 바뀌려고 합니다" | 자율 AI 에이전트가 온다!
author: @tomaszzielinski4521
comment: The follow-up stage are AI-first apps. While you can make agent click around GUI designed for human, it's not really the most efficient from AI's point of view. Every dev knows if you want to automate something, it has to have command line interface that can accept complex, chained commands. But, at the same time, these are just lines of text, lightweight and efficient, unlike image analysis or parsing the whole website HTML.

video_title: 인터넷을 파괴할 셀프 프롬프트 AI 에이전트: 완전 자율 AI 워크플로
author: Uploader(Desc)
comment:
DeepAgent는 이제 복잡한 작업을 스스로 구축, 실행 및 개선하는 완전 자율형 AI 워크플로 도구입니다. Abacus AI 기반의 DeepAgent는 웹 스크래퍼, CRM, 이메일 시스템 등의 도구를 자연어를 사용하여 연결하며, 코딩은 전혀 필요하지 않습니다. 셀프 프롬프트 에이전트, 서브 에이전트 생성, 자동화된 작업 최적화 등의 기능을 갖춘 DeepAgent는 2025년 AI 자동화의 작동 방식을 재정의하고 있습니다.
----------------
DeepAgent는 여기에서 사용해 보세요 → https://deepagent.abacus.ai/
----------------
🧠 구성:
Abacus AI는 워크플로를 스스로 구축하고 개선하는 완전 자율형 AI 에이전트인 DeepAgent를 출시했습니다.
DeepAgent는 웹 스크래핑 및 이메일 자동화부터 CRM 업데이트 및 콜드 아웃리치까지 모든 것을 처리합니다.
셀프 프롬프트 시스템, 동적 서브 에이전트, 실시간 학습을 통해 일상적인 작업을 고수준 오케스트레이션으로 전환합니다.

⚙ 자세히 알아보세요:
DeepAgent가 코드 작성 없이 몇 가지 일반 언어 입력으로 전체 시스템을 생성하는 방법
Zapier나 n8n과 같은 도구보다 더 강력하고, 더 스마트한 자동화와 번거로움 없는 설정 기능을 제공하는 이유
구직 검색, 지원 답변, 영업 전망 및 규정 준수 워크플로를 즉시 혁신하는 방법

🚨 이유 중요 사항:
DeepAgent는 2025년 자동화를 재정의하며, AI 워크플로가 인간의 개입 없이 어떻게 실행, 적응 및 진화할 수 있는지 보여줍니다.

author: @hilaschurr
comment: I was very excited to see the Job Seeker workflow in action, as I am currently looking for work and spending hours finding job listings and tailoring my resume to align with the description and be ATS compliant.  I paid the $20 and ran the workflow.  Sad to say not a single one of the links provided in the csv the ai agent produced led to an actual job listing - every single one of them resulted in a 404 Error.  I also added a task to analyze and update my existing resume for the job title and it failed miserably at that, as well.  We've go a way to go here before the hype in this video matches the actual results it produces.

author: @maxavail
comment: Soon, it will become a prerequisite for any web or mobile app to release a large action model together with its installation pack, for integration purposes, or else they won't be accepted on any app store. Companies will have employees clicking around across their own apps just to teach their LAMs how to automatically use the said app. These people will be a different team than the testers but will probably work under the QA department, just like the testers. It will surely become industry standard in any software development lifecycle.

video_title: 게임프로그래밍 독학방법 (찐독학 게임프로그래머가 알려.dream)
author: @Markgraf_ON
comment:
자연계열 나와서 대학 4학년 때 뒤늦게 프로그래밍 시작해서 3년 뒤에 게임프로그래머 취업했습니다.
여러분, 1년 정도 공부해서 대학 4년이상 공부한 전공자들이랑 취업경쟁에서 이길 수 있다는 안일한 생각은 버리세요.
게임프로그래밍에 특화하여 최적의 커리큘럼을 짠다해도 2년은 빡세게 공부해야 겨우 비벼볼만 합니다.
저는 기초적인 프로그래밍부터 1년간 천천히 공부해 보시는 걸 추천드립니다. 1년정도 취미/부전공 삼아 공부하다 보면 대충 내가 여기에 재능이 있는지, 적성이 맞는 지, 내가 이걸로 먹고살면서 정신적으로도 만족할 수 있는 지 감이 오실 겁니다.

comment: 그냥 지난 80년대부터 20년까지 프로그래머라는 직업군이 있어본결과, 추정으로는 1어릴때부터 하는게 답이다 2머리 좋은게 답이다 3노력많이 하는게 답이다 4대인관계로 여러 사람이용하는게 답이다 등등등이 있는데, 지금 견해로는 그냥 머리 좋은게 최고. 프로그래밍은 1논리 2수학 3언어 4공간지각 등의 지능이 필요함. 즉 아주 다양한 지능이 필요함.

video_title: 게임프로그래밍 독학방법 (찐독학 게임프로그래머가 알려.dream)
author: @shootingstaa
comment:
개인적으로 c > c++ 을 추천합니다. c++이 c의 진화버전이다보니 c의 주요 내용이 c++의 기초가 되기도 합니다. 따라서 기초가 튼튼해지기도 하고 컴퓨터공학의 여러 개념들을 차근차근 배운다는 느낌이 들겁니다. 물론 배우고나면 쓰기 편한건 c++이긴 합니다.
기초부터 하고싶다>c
편하고 빠르게 맛보고싶다> c++

video_title: 서버란 무엇인가요?
author: Uploader(Desc)
comment:
#서버 #코딩 #클라이언트

어렴풋이 갖고 있던 개념을 명료하게!
서버 그리고 클라이언트, 둘의 차이를 알아봅시다.

= = =

🏠 얄코사이트: https://www.yalco.kr
🛒 개발자스티커 구매: https://smartstore.naver.com/honeykers

🎥 가장 쉬운 Git 튜토리얼:    • [고정댓글필독] 가장 쉬운 Git 강좌 - (상) 혼자작업편  
🎥 포인터 쉽게 알아보기:    • 포인터가 뭐고 왜 쓰는건가요?  
🎥 객체지향에 대해 알아보기:    • [구버전, 고정댓글 필독!!] 객체지향 프로그래밍이 뭔가요?  
🎥 객체지향 디자인 패턴:    • 객체지향 디자인패턴 1  
🎥 함수형 프로그래밍이란?:    • 함수형 프로그래밍이 뭔가요?  
🎥 쿠키 vs 세션 vs 캐시:    • 쿠키, 세션, 캐시가 뭔가요?  
🎥 프로세스와 스레드:    • 프로세스는 뭐고 스레드는 뭔가요?  
🎥 비동기 프로그래밍:    • [코딩만화] 비동기 프로그래밍이 뭔가요?  
🎥 REST API 알아보기:    • [구버전 - 고정댓글 필독] REST API가 뭔가요?  
🎥 GraphQL 알아보기:    • [고정댓글 필독] GraphQL이 뭔가요?  

= = =

🎬 영상 주요 포인트

🖥 서버 vs 클라이언트 개념
사실 '서버'란 말은 역할의 개념이에요.

...

한 컴퓨터가, 네트워크로 연결된 
다른 하나 이상의 컴퓨터들에게 뭔가를 해주면

이를테면
저장된 글과 사진, 영상들을 보여주거나
반대로 그것들을 업로드받아서 보관해주거나

한 컴퓨터가 톡을 보내면 
다른 컴퓨터에게 알림을 보내거나

위치정보와 목적지를 받고 
가는길과 소요시간을 계산해주거나

여럿이 온라인으로 참여할 수 있는 
게임을 열어주거나

하면, 그 해주는, serve하는 컴퓨터가 서버,
그 service 받는 컴퓨터가 서버의 상대 개념인
손님, 클라이언트가 되는거에요.

...

한 맛집 앱을 담당하는 컴퓨터가 있어요.
이 컴퓨터는 앱이 깔린 폰들에 
맛집들의 정보를 전송해줘요.

폰들에 서비스를 제공하니까 서버인거죠.

-

그런데 이 앱이 
특정 지역의 지리 정보가 필요할 땐

이 컴퓨터가 네이버 지도 서버에
요청해서 정보를 받아와요.

이때는 이게 클라이언트가 되는거죠.

= = =

🎵 엔딩송 : 권민호, 김한영 - Let's Dance

video_title: 공돌이가 마인크래프트 서버를 만드는 방법
author: @카이트
comment:
6:50
이거 마크서버에 사용하시는 분 한국에서 되게 드문걸로 아는데
보게 되니 반가워서 추가적인 부연 설명 들어갑니다 ㅋㅋㅋ
간단히 원리를 설명하자면 여러분이 인터넷으로 유튜브 보는 원리입니다
아래는 긴글입니다



일반적인 방화벽에는 인터넷으로부터 나한테 들어오는 행위인 "인바운드"와
내가 인터넷으로 나가는 행위 "아웃바운드"의 2가지의 동작에 대한 규칙을 정의합니다

이 영상에 나오는 벽 LAN을 사용하는 서버 이용시 기본적으로 타인이 접속할 수 없는 이유는
인바운드 부분에 문제가 있기 때문입니다
물론 방화벽이 막는 것은 아니고 그보다 상위에 있는 NAT가 인바운드 요청을
어디로 보내야하는지 모르기 때문입니다
결론적으로는 접속이 불가하다는 상황이 동일합니다

Q. 어? 근데 내가 집에서 유튜브 영상 보는건
데이터를 밖에서 받아오는 행위 아닌가요?
A. 정확합니다. 그것이 이 리버스 프록시의 원리입니다

통신 규칙인 tcp의 제일 큰 특징은 수신된 데이터에 대해서 항상 응답을 한다는 것입니다
그리고 아웃바운드로 나간 연결에 대한 응답은 요청을 보냈던 호스트로
제대로 전달해주는 것이 기본적인 동작입니다

간단히 말하면 외부에서 요청이 바로 들어오는 것은 경로를 지정해줘야 하지만
내가 먼저 요청하고, 이후 응답이 날아오는 것에 대해서는 알아서 수신한다는 것입니다

이걸 사용하신 서버에 매핑을 해보면
벽 LAN을 사용하는 본체서버 S
들어올 유저분들 C
프록시 서버 P가 있습니다

C----P----S 의 구조가 되는데
여기서 P가 S에 먼저 연결 시도를 하는 것이 일반적인 프록시의 동작입니다

근데 S는 인바운드를 받을 수 없는 상태죠?

여기서 S가 P에 먼저 아웃바운드로 연결 시도를 한다면요?
그에 대해서 P가 S에 응답을 해줄 수 있겠네요

그렇다면 P가
C로부터 온 데이터를 S에 응답하는 김에 같이 보내고
S로부터 온 데이터를 C한테 전달 해줄수도 있을겁니다

이것이 리버스 프록시이고 그걸 go언어 기반으로 간편히 쓸 수 있도록 구현한 것이
영상속의 FRP입니다. 이거 아주 맛도리니 여러분 꼭 써보세요

video_title: 공돌이가 마인크래프트 서버를 만드는 방법
author: @human_tailmeat
comment:
내용이 정말 흥미롭네요. 제가 서버를 만들면서 경험한 것과 대조해가며 영상을 보니 특히 더 재미있었습니다.

저는 오래되어 쓰지 않고 있던 i5 8265u 노트북에 리눅스 민트를 올리고 fabric dedicated server를 돌리고 있습니다. 유명한 linux distro 중에 linux mint가 정말 이상할 정도로 전력을 조금밖에 쓰지 않는다는건 꽤 유명하거든요. 서버가 켜져 있고 접속자는 없는 상태, 즉 idle시, 소비 전력이 6w 정도밖에 되지 않으니, 상설서버를 돌려놓기 정말 이상적이었죠.

구동중인 서버가 모드서버라, 사실 부하 문제 때문에 기기 교체에 대해 많은 고민을 했습니다. 초당 20틱보다 아래로 떨어지지는 않지만, tick sprint가 불가능한, 딱 턱걸이 상태로 구동되는 상태였기 때문인데요. 그 때문에 서브컴으로 놀려두고 있던 ryzen 3600 pc에 동일한 세팅으로 서버를 구동해 보았는데, 수치상으로 확인되는 싱글코어 성능 차이에 비해 실체감 프레임 차이는 거의 없더군요. 그런데 전력소모 적으로는 이야기가 많이 달랐습니다. 부하가 걸리는 상태에서의 전력소모는 비슷했지만, idle시 전력소모는 6배에 달했거든요. 압도적으로 낮은 idle시 전력소모를 이유로, 부하 피크시 프레임 방어는 약간 포기하고 전성비 쪽을 택하게 되었었습죠.

저전력 개인용 서버 cpu로 유명한 n100도 고려 대상이었고, n100의 싱글코어 성능이 8265u보다 약간이나마 더 좋은것도 사실이라 꽤 구미가 당기는 옵션이었지만, 모드서버의 경우 멀티코어 오프로딩을 잘 해 주는 최적화 모드가 많아 싱글코어 성능보다 멀티코어 성능이 좀 더 중요하고, 거기서 8265u의 더 많은 코어 수가 장점을 가지더군요. n100으로 가려면 장치를 새로 사야 하기도 해서, 여러모로 8265u 모드서버가 제가 취할 수 있는 옵션 중 가장 좋은 옵션이었습니다.

하지만 n100으로 서버 기기를 선택했을 때의 가능성을 대리로 본 것 같은 느낌이라 대단히 흥미로웠습니다.

그 와중에 한가지 질문이 있습니다. dedicated server에는 자체적인 화이트리스트 기능이 있을 겁니다. 모든 유저가 마인크래프트 정품 사용자라면 포트포워딩과 방화벽 인바운드 룰, 그리고 자체적인 화이트리스트 기능만으로 개인 서버 수준에서는 충분한 보안이 달성 가능할 터입니다. 그런데 굳이 복잡하게 리버스 프록시를 선택하신 이유가 있으신가요?

솔직히 단순하게 생각하자면 그냥 서버 멤버 중에 복돌 유저가 있어서 그렇다고 보는게 제일 자연스럽다고 생각하지만, 만약 전원이 정품유저인데도 리버스 프록시를 택하셨다면, 저도 배워가야 할 필요가 있어 보여 여쭙습니다. 사실 개인 아이피를 노출한 상태로, 포트포워드로 외부망에 포트 하나가 노출되어 있는 상황이 안전하다고 생각되진 않거든요.

video_title: vSphere Certificate Manager를 사용하여 VMware vCenter 인증서 만료 문제를 해결하는 방법
author: Uploader(Desc)
comment:
Renewing vCenter Certificates Using VMware Certificate Manager - vCenter error- no healthy upstream.

In today’s video, I’ll guide you through the process of renewing vCenter certificates using VMware Certificate Manager. If you’re facing issues accessing your vCenter server or seeing errors like “No healthy upstream,” there’s a good chance your vCenter certificate has expired, causing critical services to stop.

This tutorial will walk you through each step, from identifying expired certificates to resetting them and regaining access to your vCenter environment.

🔍 What You’ll Learn:
How to identify expired vCenter certificates.
How to access the vCenter Server Appliance via SSH to check vCenter certificate expiration details.
Step-by-step guide to using the vSphere Certificate Manager to renew vCenter SSL certificates.
Replacing all certificates and reconfiguring necessary details for a smooth vCenter certificate renewal.
Verifying successful access to vCenter after completing the VMware vCenter SSL certificate renewal process.
⚙️ Course Content:
Troubleshooting vCenter access errors related to certificate expiration.
Command-line steps for verifying certificate expiration on the vCenter appliance.
How to use vSphere Certificate Manager to replace SSL certificates and resolve the vCenter certificate expired issue.
Inputting vCenter details like IP address and hostname to complete the reset.
Final verification of a successful renewal by accessing the vCenter console.
📚 Who Should Watch:
VMware admins and engineers working with vSphere and vCenter Server.
IT professionals managing VMware environments who need to troubleshoot and fix vCenter certificate expired issues.
Anyone looking for a hands-on tutorial on using the vSphere Certificate Manager for vCenter SSL certificate renewal.
🔔 Stay Updated: Don’t forget to like, share, and subscribe for more tutorials on VMware vCenter, vSphere, and cloud computing best practices.

📚 Related Playlists:
VMware vSphere Troubleshooting
VMware vCenter Management and Maintenance
VMware Certificate Manager Tutorials
💬 Connect with Us:
LinkedIn:   / globaltechnologyoptions  
Facebook:   / globaltechnologyoptions  
YouTube:    / @globaltechnologyoptions  

Got questions about vCenter certificate renewal, or how to use vSphere Certificate Manager to replace SSL certificates? Drop them in the comments, and we’ll be happy to assist!

comment:
It would be good to include the commands as it was promoted in the video:
for store in $(/usr/lib/vmware-vmafd/bin/vecs-cli store list | grep -v TRUSTED_ROOT_CRLS); do echo "[*] Store :" $store;  /usr/lib/vmware-vmafd/bin/vecs-cli entry list --store $store --text | grep -ie "Alias" -ie "Not After"; done;

/usr/lib/vmware-vmca/bin/certificate-manager


Option 4 (Regenerate a new VMCA root certificate and  replace all certificates) instead of Reset all Certificates (8)  could be also fine

INSERT INTO customer (CustID, CustName, Age, City, Salary)

video_title: AWS re:Invent 2023 - 영역 자동 전환을 사용하여 AZ 손상에서 자동으로 복구(ARC309)
author: Uploader(Desc)
comment:
Building highly resilient applications in the cloud requires building across multiple Availability Zones, capacity planning for redundancy, and having mechanisms in place to ensure that requests are routed away from occasional, temporary failures—both hard and gray—in an Availability Zone. Learn how you can design and monitor applications to detect and automatically recover from failures within Availability Zones using capabilities such as the Amazon Route 53 Application Recovery Controller zonal shift.

Learn more about AWS re:Invent at https://go.aws/46iuzGv.

Subscribe:
More AWS videos: http://bit.ly/2O3zS75
More AWS events videos: http://bit.ly/316g9t4

ABOUT AWS
Amazon Web Services (AWS) hosts events, both online and in-person, bringing the cloud computing community together to connect, collaborate, and learn from AWS experts.

AWS is the world's most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform, offering over 200 fully featured services from data centers globally. Millions of customers—including the fastest-growing startups, largest enterprises, and leading government agencies—are using AWS to lower costs, become more agile, and innovate faster.

#AWSreInvent #AWSreInvent2023

video_title: Asyncio를 활용한 Python의 차세대 동시 프로그래밍
author: Uploader(Desc)
comment:
💡 Learn how to design great software in 7 steps: https://arjan.codes/designguide.

If your software interacts with external APIs, you need to know concurrent programming. I show you how it works in Python and then take it to the next level by showing advanced concurrent features such as using async with generators and comprehensions, show a simple way to turn blocking code into concurrent code, and then I cover how concurrency affects software design and architecture.

The code I worked on in this episode is available here: https://github.com/ArjanCodes/2022-as....

🎓 ArjanCodes Courses: https://www.arjancodes.com/courses/

🔖 Chapters:
0:00 Intro
1:10 Concurrency vs parallelism
2:33 The Global Interpreter Lock
3:06 The benefits of concurrency
4:36 Recap of asyncio in Python
7:13 Using gather to send out multiple requests
9:44 How async and await are integrated into Python's syntax
11:54 Turn blocking code into concurrent code
16:04 Async http requests
16:53 Aiohttp
17:50 Concurrency, design patterns, and architecture

comment:
Regarding your criticism about nested contextmanagers (at 17:35)... 

Since Python3.10 you are able to write something like this:

    async with (
        aiohttp.ClientSession() as session,
        session.get(url) as response,
    ):
        return await response.json()


This is super usefull :)

author: @fartzy
comment: I think one way to say it - to say parallelism vs concurrency - is to say the system parallelizes.  However, the system handles concurrency. The system chooses to parallelize.  The system reacts to concurrency.

video_title: Asyncio를 활용한 Python의 차세대 동시 프로그래밍
author: @leoff2
comment: you didn't mention the difference between using `requests` + `to_thread`, and `aiohttp`. Although `aiohttp` is more verbose, it is faster since it involves no threads. You can also reduce indentation by creating the session beforehand and reusing it.

video_title: 프로그래밍 초식 : DB 트랜잭션 조금 이해하기 02 격리
author: @codongcodong
comment:
강의 감사합니다. 궁금한 것이 있습니다

14:16 Repeatable Read의 경우 특정 버전에 해당하는 데이터를 읽는다고 했는데요

만약 Repeatable Read가 트랜잭션이 시작될 때 "특정 스냅샷 정보"만 일관성 있게 읽어온다면, 

Phantom Read랑 헷갈리는 부분이, 다른 트랜잭션에서 insert 했던 정보도 당연히 무시해야 하는데, Phantom Read가 insert, delete에 영향을 받는 현상이니 헷갈립니다

Read skew 문제점인 update 변경은 무시하는데, insert, delete 추가 삭제의 영향을 받는 것은 내부적인 구현의 한계 때문인건가요?

video_title: 프로그래밍 초식 : DB 트랜잭션 조금 이해하기 02 격리
author: @please-zp5le
comment:
17:40  원자적 연산에 대해서 질문드립니다.

[질문 정리]
db마다 원자적 연산 지원 여부, 지원하는 쿼리 형태를 어디에서 확인하면 되나요?
mysql 같은 경우 테스트해봤을 때 지원하는 거 같은데, mysql 사이트에서 해당 내용이 안보입니다.


[내용]
update article set readcnt = readcnt+1 where id =1; 와 같은 특정 형식의 쿼리만 지원을 하는 건가요? 아니면 지원하는 쿼리 형태가 여러개 있는건가요? 
그리고 db에서 실제로 원자적 연산을 지원하는 지 확인해야 된다고 해주셨는데요.  db 사이트에서 확인해보면 되는 걸까요?

mysql atomic operation
mysql cursor stability
로 검색해보기도 하고
아래에서 찾아봤는데 일치하는 내용이 안 보여요.( 영어를 잘 못해서 못 찾는 걸 수도 있습니다.)


java, spring boot, jpa, mysql 환경에서 테스트해봤을 때 update article set readcnt = readcnt+1 where id =1;  형태로 쿼리 날려보니까 멀티쓰레드 코드에서 변경 유실 발생 안 하고 동시성 처리가 됩니다.
(참고로 java단 코드에서 if문에 의해서 값이 달라져야 하는 경우나 +1연산을 java단에서 해서 update 쿼리를 날리는 경우 변경 유실이 발생했어요.)

video_title: 함수형 프로그래밍이 어려운 이유 (사고의 전환 등 배울 가치 충분)
author: Uploader(Desc)
comment:
함수형 프로그래밍(functional programming)을 배우는 과정에서 겪는 경험과 깨달음을 다룹니다. 그 도전과 보상을 둘 다 설명합니다.

하스켈(Haskell)이나 엘릭서(Elixir) 같은 함수형 언어를 배우며 겪은 어려움은 다양합니다.

순수 함수와 불변성과 같은 이점을 인식하면서도 함수형 프로그래밍(FP)의 독특한 사고방식과 추상적인 개념들이 어렵게 느껴집니다.

명령형 프로그래밍 습관을 버리는 일과 모나드(monad) 같은 복잡한 개념을 이해하는 어려움을 설명합니다.

함수형 프로그래밍은 작성 코드의 명확성 향상과 더 나은 추상화 방법을 제시해 줍니다.

그리고 함수형 언어의 특성상 동시성 프로그래밍에 적합할 수 있습니다.

함수형 언어의 학습 곡선은 가파르지만, 그 과정을 통해 얻는 코딩 통찰력을 얻게 됩니다.

이 결국 더 나은 프로그래머로 성장하게 해줍니다.

이번 영상 주요 논점입니다:

1. 어려움 1: 불변성(immutability)과 상태(state) 관리. 이는 프로그래밍에 대한 근본적인 도전입니다.

2. 어려움 2: 프로그램 흐름을 다루는 새로운 방식으로 반복문(loop)이 없습니다. 함수형 프로그래밍(FP)은 다른 사고방식을 요구합니다. 불변성(immutability)과 명령형 언어의 반복문 대신, 고차 함수(higher-order functions), map, foldr, 재귀(recursion) 등을 사용하는 흐름 제어 방식을 채택합니다.

3. 어려움 3: 추상적인 개념들 (모나드, 고차 함수 등). 함수형 언어 핵심 개념들 때문에 도전적으로 느껴질 수 있습니다. 모나드와 같은 추상적인 개념들이 처음에는 혼란스러울 수 있습니다. 함수형 프로그래밍은 순수 함수를 통한 코드 품질 향상을 도모합니다.

4. 기타 어려움: 에러 메시지, 피드백. 불변성 덕분에 버그는 줄어듭니다.

5. 보람 1: 순수 함수로 향상되는 코드 품질. 함수형 프로그래밍(functional programming)을 배웠을 때의 보람(reward)를 설명합니다.

6. 보람 2: 불변성을 통한 버그 감소

7. 보람 3: 향상된 추상화와 유지 보수성

8. 보람 4: 동시성(concurrency)과 병렬 처리(parallelism)에 유리함

9. 보람 5: 프로그래밍에 대한 더 깊은 이해. 프로그래밍 원리와 패러다임에 대해 깊이 생각하게 합니다.

10. 논평: 도전 가치가 있는 프로그래밍 여정. 이러한 함수형 언어가 요구 하는 새로운 사고방식과 특징들은 함수형 프로그래밍을 완전히 사용하지 않더라도 프로그래밍의 이해도를 깊게 만들어 줍니다.

video_title: 함수형 프로그래밍이 어려운 이유 (사고의 전환 등 배울 가치 충분)
author: @DongyoonHan
comment: 전통적 알골계열 언어에서 말하는 함수와 다릅니다. 함수형이라는 것 자체가 수학에서 말하는 함수 그 자체입니다.

video_title: 함수형 프로그래밍이 어려운 이유 (사고의 전환 등 배울 가치 충분)
author: @1dulee289
comment:
함수형... 확실히 재밌는 컨셉이고 몇가지는 쉽게 도입가능함.
개인적으로 가장 큰 장점은, 오류가 숨을 장소가 없다는게 가장 큰 장점. 함수형을 해보면, 아 내 코드가 이렇게 위험한 부분이 많았구나를 느끼게됨. 집합의 대응으로 보는 관점도 테스트 코드 작성할때 도움을 많이 받았던거 같다.
단점은, 만약 모든 기능을 함수형으로 작성하려고 한다면, 쓸데없이 너무 복잡한 코드나, 성능이 떨어지는 코드가 생김.

현실적으로 적절한 타협점을 찾는게 중요한듯

author: @dhp5865
comment:
javascript에서 map/reduce 사용한 코드를 for loop으로 구현해서 benchmark해 본 적이 있는데요
for loop 코드가 실행 속도가 빨랐고 이해하기도 직관적이었습니다만, map/reduce 코드가 깔끔했고 오류 생길 가능성도 낮아보였습니다

comment:

author: @meinlet5103
comment: 함수형은 생각을 끝까지 전개 안해도 되서 편한듯. 프로그래밍으로 치면 lazy evaluation 같은 느낌

video_title: 함수형 프로그래밍이 어려운 이유 (사고의 전환 등 배울 가치 충분)
author: @signalism
comment:
함수형 프로그래밍에서 가장 중요한건
에러처리와 결과처리입니다.

에러처리는 사실상 validation에 가깝고
타겟한 현상계를 표현합니다.
절대법칙의 틀을 간단하게 적는거죠.


마지막으로 가장 중요한건
결과처리 식을  return 한줄에 담는겁니다.

이걸 하지 못하고 있다면 그건 함수형 프로그래밍이 아닙니다.

그 전에 있던 모든과정이 이걸 위함이니까요

이게 아니면 함수형 프로그래밍이 아닙니다.

자 이제부터 함수가 아닌 프로그램 단위에서 보도록하죠.

결론적으로 우리는 함수형 인터페이스로 프로그램과 비즈니스 로직을 구축 할 수는 있지만 100% 함수형 프로그래밍은 절대 불가능합니다.

기본적인 Sort 조차 함수형 프로그래밍이 아닙니다

왜 일까요? 수학과 그 안의 함수는 
자연을 표현하고자 한겁니다.

그런데 정렬 같은것은 인간이 자신의 기준에 따라 인위적으로 나열해서
표현하고자 했습니다.

이건 수학이 아니에요. 자연법칙도 아니구요.

기준 순서 절차 제도 인간이 만든 개념입니다.

for문이요? map? filter? if? reduce?
모두 동일합니다.

인간이 정의하고자 표현하는것들은
수학도 아니고 함수도 아니에요

절차 제도등으로 자연현상을 가둬 자신들의 예측 범위 안에 두고 통제하기 위함입니다.

이건 절대로 함수형 프로그래밍으로 구현할수 없구요.

금융계도 마찬가지입니다.

일단 도입부터 선형적이지 않은 범주의
변수들 즉 우리는 문자열에 대해서
 if 혹은 case처리를 해야합니다. 여기서 끝이죠 
함수형이 아닙니다. 절차형이죠

우린 코어 및 util 디렉토리 정도에서나
함수형을 유지할수 있습니다.

사실 프로그래밍에서 가장 중요한건
인간의 기준과 자연의 기준을 구분하고
섞이지 않도록 하는겁니다.

특히 자연계 함수내부에 인간계 절차 함수를 쓰면 절대 안됩니다.
인간계 절차함수로 자연계함수를 끌고와야죠.

인간계 함수 비즈니스로직에는
절차형과 재현형이 있는데

재현단계 함수에서 자연형 함수 잘 가져다 쓰시는게 능력입니다.

재현도 사실 자연형 함수는 안쓰는 경우가 많아서 유틸형 함수에서 많이들 가져다 쓰시죠.

기본적인건 다 언어에 내장되어 있으니까요

author: @babol_
comment: FP는 꽤 재미있는 패러다임이지만, 초기 개발 비용을 확실히 증가시킵니다. 미래의 유지보수 비용을 상당량 현재에 미리 지불하는 것인데, 일반적으로 현재의 재화가치가 미래의 것보다 높게 평가되는 것을 생각해보면 새로운 프로젝트에 대한 적극적인 도입이 간혹 꺼려지는 이유를 슬쩍 알 수 있습니다.

video_title: 함수형 프로그래밍이 어려운 이유 (사고의 전환 등 배울 가치 충분)
author: @marksmithcollins
comment:
스몰토크 때 객체가 만물의 척도다 엥이 하는 기조
하스켈은 진짜로 만물을 함수로 표현해서 모든 곳에 넣을 수 있다는 기조
DOD, ECS 구조로 모든 종류의 애플리케이션을 다 만든다는 기조
뭐든지 Rust로 다시 쓰면 아무튼 박수받을텐데 님거는 왜 안하냐는 기조

영화인지 무엇인지는 기억 안나지만 '나만은 다르다, 나라면 쓸어버릴 수 있다' 라는 도전자들이 연병장 이열종대로 두바퀴를 채웠지만 결국 강바닥 밑에 있다는 말이 있는데
'내가 생각하는 기가막히는 혁신' 이 중요한 것이 아니라, 내재적 개선과 산업자체의 구조와 사회적 상황까지 합쳐진 거대한 흐름 속에서 정말로 세대를 교체하는 것을 구별해내기는
정말로 정말로 웅덩이 안에서 난다긴다하는 문가들이라 해도 힘들다는 걸 느낍니다

video_title: 함수형 프로그래밍이 어려운 이유 (사고의 전환 등 배울 가치 충분)
author: @iliiiliiiiliiii
comment:
0:43 명령형-객체지향 <-> 함수형이 아니라 순차지향형 <-> 함수형이라고 해야햐지 않나요.
(객체지향 <-> 절차지향은 함수형과는 다른 개념으로 알고 있어서요.)
저도 함수형으로 개인프로젝트 몇개 하고 있는데요...
음... 사이드 이팩트가 없는 순수함수[(a) -> b]는 사실상 불가능한거 같습니다...
어느정도 익숙해지면 편하고 좋긴한데.. 가끔 로직을 만드는게 아니라 로직을 함수에 맞출때가 있어서...........
그거 말고는 만족도가 높긴합니다.
전 무결성 이런거보다 논블록킹과 쓰레드풀(함부로 막 쓰레드를 만들지 않고 함수들이 쓰레드풀에서 실행되는) 관점에서 큰 매리트를 느낍니다.

video_title: edX | LouvainX: 컴퓨터 프로그래밍의 패러다임: 비디오 소개
author: Uploader(Desc)
comment:
Paradigms of Computer Programming

This course covers functional, object-oriented, and declarative dataflow programming in a unified framework.

Register for Paradigms of Computer Programming from LouvainX at http://www.edx.org/courses. 

About this Course

This course gives an introduction to all major programming concepts, techniques, and paradigms in a unified framework. We cover the three main programming paradigms: functional, object-oriented, and declarative dataflow. We explain the four ways to do data abstraction and discuss the trade-offs between objects and abstract data types. We present declarative dataflow, the most useful paradigm for concurrent programming, and show how it avoids race conditions. We give a simple formal semantics for all concepts and illustrate them with practical code that runs on the accompanying open-source platform, the Mozart Programming System. This course is targeted toward people with a basic knowledge of programming. It will be most useful to beginning programming students, but the unconventional approach should be insightful even to seasoned professionals.

video_title: C++에서의 동시 프로그래밍 - Venkat Subramaniam
author: Uploader(Desc)
comment:
Programming concurrency is often lard. The concurrency API of C++ alleviates a lot of those problems.

We will start with a discussion of the perils of concurrency and dive into how to make use of the wonderful facilities provided in C++ for concurrent programming.

Speaker: Venkat Subramaniam

author: @darthnegativehunter8659
comment:
no one ever smiles, should change to everyone cries.
multiple types of custom locks,  and customizable callbacks. and you are FUCKED
std::lock doesn't help much. it's for locking all of the locks at the same call -_-
sometimes(in my case, all of the time), for better performance, you don't want to lock anything until it is needed. and that will be decided by the information extracted from the previously locked stuff. and they are supposed to do this, in separate places.
also, the problem of not doing timeouts : you will be less afraid of deadlocks, and therefor not detect them at early stages. you may end up with a bad data structure

video_title: 분산 비동기 대기 • 클라우드를 위한 새로운 프로그래밍 모델 - Dominik Tornow - NDC Oslo 2024
author: Uploader(Desc)
comment:
This talk was recorded at NDC Oslo in Oslo, Norway. #ndcoslo #ndcconferences #developer #softwaredeveloper    

Attend the next NDC conference near you: 
https://ndcconferences.com
https://ndcoslo.com/

Subscribe to our YouTube channel and learn every day:   
/    ‪@NDC‬ 

Follow our Social Media!

  / ndcconferences  
  / ndc_conferences  
  / ndc_conferences  

#cloud #concurrency #programminglanguages #ndcoslo #ndcconferences #developer #code 

Modern cloud-based applications are composed of countless concurrent, distributed processes pushing traditional programming models past their breaking point.

Distributed Async Await, a new programming model for the cloud, extends the simplicity of async-await to tame the complexity of the cloud. Building on the foundations of functions and promises, Distributed Async Await enables “simple code that just works”.

In this talk, we will explore the theoretical and practical foundations that makes this elegant approach possible. Gain a comprehensive understanding of async-await, functions, promises, and the vital concepts of concurrency and coordination in distributed systems. Take away actionable insights on how to replicate the delightful developer experience of traditional applications as you craft cloud-based, distributed applications.

Design and develop cloud applications that are not only scalable and reliable but downright delightful to work on. Transform the way you approach cloud computing.

video_title: Angular 서비스를 사용하여 컴포넌트 간 데이터 공유 | Angular 15 마스터하기(고급) | 강의 33
author: Uploader(Desc)
comment:
Angular is a popular front-end web development framework created and maintained by Google. It is an open-source framework that uses TypeScript, a superset of JavaScript and follows the Model-View-Controller (MVC) architecture pattern.
Some of the features and capabilities of Angular include two-way data binding, dependency injection, components, directives, pipes, routing, and testing.
Angular provides a seamless way to synchronize data between the model and the view. Any changes made to the model are automatically reflected in the view and vice versa.
Angular uses a dependency injection system that helps to manage and organize code more effectively.
Angular applications are built using reusable and modular components that can be easily combined to create complex user interfaces.
Directives are special attributes that can be added to HTML tags to provide additional functionality, such as hiding or showing elements based on certain conditions.
Pipes are used to transform data in templates, such as formatting dates or converting text to uppercase.
Angular provides a powerful routing system that allows for easy navigation between different views in an application.
Angular has built-in support for testing, making it easy to write and run unit tests for your application.
Overall, Angular is a powerful framework that enables developers to build complex, scalable, and performant web applications with ease.

video_title: Kotlin에서 구조화된 동시성을 사용한 우아한 리소스 처리
author: Uploader(Desc)
comment:
Modern programming often requires us to guarantee how our applications terminate. One way to do this is through structured concurrency, which allows us to reason about parallel processes and how they relate.

In this session, we will learn how to use Arrow’s Resource Domain-Specific Language (DSL) to reason about resource safety, like we use structured concurrency to avoid leaking resources. We will also see how this can be combined with KotlinX Coroutines to build complex use cases and elegantly use Kotlin DSLs.

#kotlin #structuredconcurrency #coroutines 
Demo source code: https://github.com/nomisRev/ktor-k8s-...

Speaker: Simon Vergauwen, Tech Lead at 47 Degrees

2:44 Problem description

8:20 Adding shutdown hooks

13:52 Why graceful shutdown is essential?

24:44 More about SuspendApp for Ktor
32:10 What is resourceScope?
36:20 More extensions for working with the environment in Ktor
46:00 Using Either and handling errors
56:20 Working with dependencies
1:03:35 Summary

7:33 - in video there is option to add interface configuration which is slightly different on new versions, and if you have already created and linked an interface.
to create an interface, first create the tunnel and save (As per video) then:
Interface -> Assignments -> under Available networks drop-down, should have 'tun_wg0(tun_wg0)' as option
Fill in details as per the interface section in the video.

video_title: Wireguard란 무엇일까요? "새로운" VPN 프로토콜 + OpenVPN과의 비교
author: Uploader(Desc)
comment:
Why is WireGuard becoming more popular? The answer is simple, WireGuard is a fast, free, and new open-source VPN connection protocol. Learn how to setup your own Wireguard VPN here:    • How to Roll Your Own VPN for FREE (30 min ...  

See this comprehensive list of VPNs that run Wireguard: https://www.allthingssecured.com/vpn/...

Read more about WireGuard here: https://www.allthingssecured.com/vpn/...

🔹🔹🔹Recommended VPNs with WireGuard🔹🔹🔹

  ✅ Mullvad VPN: https://www.allthingssecured.com/try/...
  ✅ NordVPN: https://www.allthingssecured.com/try/...
  ✅ VyprVPN: https://www.allthingssecured.com/try/...


*********************
Video Timestamps
*********************
0:00 - Introduction to VPN protocols
1:01 - How Wireguard Works
1:39 - Benefits of Using Wireguard
3:00 - Best VPNs that Use Wireguard
*********************

Simply put, Wireguard is a free, open-source VPN connection protocol that has proven to be faster, simpler and more lightweight than other encryption protocols. 

If that doesn’t make sense to you - and don’t worry, you’re not alone - think about this: OpenVPN, which is currently considered the security standard for VPN protocols, runs on 600,000 lines of code. IPSec, another standard VPN protocol, has 400,000 lines of code.

Wireguard runs on 4,000.

That’s a 99% reduction in code, which has made it much easier to manage as well as to debug. In this case, simpler is definitely better. Not to mention that this represents what is considered to be a stronger encryption method.

Over the next few minutes, I’m going to explain how Wireguard works, the benefits of using Wireguard, and finally the best VPN services that are now running the Wireguard protocol.

I’ll start by saying that Wireguard was initially developed back in 2016 as an alternative connection protocol for the Linux operating system.

What we’re dealing with here is a way to encrypt communication between two devices, which could be your computer and your corporate network, a server and a machine, your phone and the cellular network...whatever.

This is important when passing sensitive information across the open internet. There are already a lot of encryption measures in place, but a virtual private network or “VPN”, adds an additional layer of security.

But what makes Wireguard so special when we have perfectly good protocols we can use already?

It can really be boiled down to three things:

First, Wireguard creates a stable connection faster than previous protocols. I’ve already seen this myself in multiple cases where it takes less than 1-2 seconds to establish a connection through Wireguard when it normally takes between 5-10 seconds using OpenVPN.

It can also switch from mobile networks to WiFi networks without dropping, which is a huge benefit.

You see, the old connection protocols were designed decades ago and have been slowed by all the over-engineering that has taken place to make them meet different needs.

Second, Wireguard has been tested to perform up to 4 times better than OpenVPN and IPsec-based VPNs. That means you can get up to 4 times faster speeds when you’re connected to the VPN, which if you’ve used a VPN for any period of time, you know how important that is.

Finally, Wireguard utilizes modern cryptography that has been peer-reviewed and promoted by numerous security experts. All VPN protocols provide a level of security, but only Wireguard takes advantage of new methods such as cryptokey routing.

For you, the user, the only thing that really matters is that the VPN protocol connects quickly, stays connected and gives you fast connection speeds.

Now, unless you’re incredibly tech savvy and feel comfortable setting up your own virtual private network at home, most of us are going to be using a commercial VPN that has integrated Wireguard into their applications.

#vpn #wireguard #infosec

video_title: Ubiquiti Insider: UniFi Network 7.3 | ISP 디자인 센터 | EV 스테이션 [2022년 11월]
author: Uploader(Desc)
comment:
Welcome to Ubiquiti Insider, where we share insights into the latest Ubiquiti R&D advancements. 

Let’s start with UniFi’s expanded VPN experience: For an absolute no-hassle VPN setup, we have invented something we call Teleport.  Just launch the WiFiMan app on any smart device anywhere in the world and connect.  It’s that simple.

And if you’re a power user that still prefers a traditional VPN Server setup, we have you covered with the faster performance of WireGuard, now also in 7.3

Finally, what if you just want a single device on your network always connected to VPN?  Perhaps a TV connected to Switzerland? No problem! Simply create a Traffic Route and use the new VPN client bridging feature to direct traffic for a specific device to anywhere in the world.

Moving on to our security advancements: Our expanded system log now provides admins with powerful event tracking of their deployments. From session activity, to configuration changes, UniFi’s system log provides timestamped details along with a fully customizable push notification system.

We’ve also updated UniFi Talk and our line of Touch and Touch Max Phones, enabling greater customizability with a pin-protected Lock Screen, scheduling for your status, wallpapers, and the ability to assign specific ringtones to contacts. Additionally, we introduced an intercom feature, and the ability to send and receive SMS with your Talk numbers so you can interact and engage with your contacts in more ways. Finally, make sure a call is always answered with Ring Flow, where you can customize a ringing sequence for your incoming calls. And with the ability to set a Failover Redirect Number you can protect against any service interruptions. 

USIP and ISP Design Center now work together to make link planning even easier. In UISP Network, simply click on the ISP Design Center icon on the map and your network will be seamlessly integrated into ISP Design Center. From here, you can import a UISP network from your account or a self-hosted application so you can quickly plan and simulate coverage for new customers, and continue expanding your network.

And with the Profitability Calculator you can see a detailed financial analysis of your imported network, adjust your subscriber count and simulate different internet plans to see when you can expect to reach profitability. Start designing your deployment: https://ispdesign.ui.com

We announced the WiFiman Wizard, a new battery-powered Spectrum Analyzer that connects via bluetooth to your smartphone and brings spectral magic to your WiFiman App, unlocking incredible insight to help you build better wireless experiences.

We introduced the UniFi EV Station, the world’s first EV charging platform specifically designed for organizations. And with the UI mobile app, organization members can start charging their electric vehicles with a single touch of a button.

We also introduced our first product within UniFi Mobility, the UniFi Mobile Router, a compact LTE router that can be instantly set up to provide reliable Internet in any environment – even on the move.

Learn more at UI.com and join us next time for another Ubiquiti Insider. #RethinkingIT

Subscribe for more Ubiquiti Insider updates!

video_title: 초보자를 위한 Framer 완벽가이드 10단계 | 초고퀄 | 프레이머무료강좌
author: Uploader(Desc)
comment:
Framer 페이지 바로가기: https://guidebean.com/framer
Framer 가이드 페이지: https://guidebean.com/framer-ai-guide/

처음 Framer 를 배우려는 초보자분들을 위해 프레이머 사용법을 준비했습니다. 프레이머는 코딩없이 노코드로 애니메이션을 포함한 다양한 인터렉티브한 고품질 웹사이트 제작 툴입니다. 캔버스에서 그림을 그리듯이 제작하는 방식으로 제대로 배운다면 누구나 창의적인 자신만의 홈페이지 만들기가 가능합니다.

이 영상에서는 데모 프레미어 랜딩페이지를 10단계를 통해 단계별로 직접 따라하며 제작하게 됩니다. 프레이머 AI 기능도 있지만, 이를 제대로 활용하려면 사용법부터 익혀야 제대로 제작이 가능합니다. 그러므로 이 가이드 강의를 통해 기본 사용법을 제대로 배우시기 바랍니다.
이 가이드는 Framer 제휴마케팅 활동의 일환으로, 이에 따른 일정액의 수수료를 제공받을 수 있습니다. 이는 추가 비용을 발생시키지 않으며, 높은 품질의 가이드 영상을 무료로 제공하는데 큰 도움이 됩니다. 감사합니다.
영상 가이드 순서 미리보기

00:00:00 0-0. 인트로
00:02:00 1-1. Framer 사이트 예제 살펴보기

00:29:50 4-1. 텍스트 스타일 가이드 만들기

video_title: #42 인디자인에서 애니메이션 지정하기와 웹페이지로 이동하는 QR코드 만들기 #indesign
author: Uploader(Desc)
comment:
인디자인에서 디지털 광고 문서에서 개체에 애니메이션 효과를 주어서 더욱 재미있고 설득력있는 문서로 만들 수 있습니다. 텍스트, 도형, 사진에 애니메이션을 지정하는 방법을 배웁니다. 길거리의 광고판을 들여다보면 어느새부턴가 정사각형 모양의 불규칙한 마크가 하나 들어 있음을 알 수 있습니다. 
특수기호나 상형문자 같기도 한 이 마크를 ‘QR코드’라 한다. QR은 ‘Quick Response’의 약자로 ‘빠른 응답’을 얻을 수 있다는 의미이다. 인디자인에서는 무척 간단하게 OR 코드를 만들 수 있습니다. 스마트폰으로 쇼핑몰의 특정한 상품 페이지, 이벤트 페이지로 소비자들을 안내할 수 있는 방법입니다.

00:00 인트로
00:30 인디자인에서 멀티미디어 효과 적용된 문서 편집하기
01:20 예제 파일 열기
02:20 인디자인에서 애니메이션 기능의 역할
03:00 사진 이미지에 애니메이션 효과 지정하기
03:30 Place 대화상자를 열어 사진 이미지 불러들여 생성하기
[File 메뉴의 Place를 클릭하여 사진 이미지를 불러들여 페이지에 삽입한다]

04:20 Animation 패널 열어 애니메이션 효과 지정하기
[Window 메뉴의 Interactive에서 Animation 클릭하여 Animation 패널 열기/사진 이미지 개체 선택하여 Animation 패널의 Preset에서 애니메이션 효과 지정한다]

05:10 Animation 패널에서 Preset의 애니메이션 효과들 설명
06:00 Animation 패널에서 적용된 애니메이션 효과(Fly in from Left) 재생하기
[사진 이미지 개체 선택하여 Animation 패널의 Preset에서 애니메이션 효과 지정한다/Event에서는 상용자가 어떠한 행동을 할 때 애니메이션을 실행하는지를 지정하고/ Duration에서는 지속시간을 지정한다]

08:45 애니메이션 실행하기
[Animation 패널에서 Preview Spread EPUB를 클릭하여/EPUB Intractivity Preview  창을 열어 애니메이션을 실행시킨다]

10:30 QR 코드의 개념과 마케팅과 판매에서의 활용 설명 
[🙋QR 코드에 대한 설명과 안내 웹페이지 https://qr.naver.com/]

14:20 QR 코드 생성하기 위해 페이지 추가하기
14:45 QR 코드로 이동시킬 웹페이지 주소 복사하기
16:17 OR 코드 생성하기
[Object 메뉴의 Generate QR Code 클릭하여 대화상자 연다/ 복사해둔 웹페이지 주소를  URL 상자에 붙여넣기한 후/OK 단추 클릭하여 OR 코드 생성한다/QR코드가 마우스포인터에 보이면 원하는 페이지의 위치에 드래그한다]

17:09 생성된 QR 코드를 설명하는 텍스트 작성하여 편집하기
19:50 학교 홈페이지로 이동시키는 QR 코드 생성하기
22:57 유튜브의 특정 영상으로 이동시키는 QR 코드 생성하기
 
▶실무자를 위한 파워포인트    • 파워포인트와 프레젠테이션  
▶광고 이야기    • 광고와 PR 미디어 기획  
▶30분에 배우는 어도비 디멘션    • 30분에 배우는 어도비 디멘션

▶4차 산업혁명 공부하기 재생목록으로 보기    • 4차 산업혁명 공부하기  
▶30분에 배우는 왕초보 컴퓨터    • 왕초보 컴퓨터 100가지

▶모두를 위한 인디자인 재생목록으로 보기    • 편집 디자인 실무를 위한 인디자인  
▶30분에 배우는 프리미어 재생목록으로 보기 :    • 프리미어와 영상 편집

▶영상 편집을 위한 다빈치 리졸브 재생목록    • 영상 편집을 위한 다빈치 리졸브

video_title: Alexandr Wang: Building Scale AI, Transforming Work With Agents & Competing With China
author: Uploader(Desc)
comment:
Alexandr Wang started Scale AI to help machine learning teams label data faster.

It started as a simple API for human labor, but behind the scenes, he was tackling a much bigger problem: how to turn messy, real-world data into something AI could learn from. Today, that early idea powers a multi-hundred-million-dollar engine behind America's AI infrastructure—fueling everything from Fortune 500 workflows to real-time military planning. 

Just last week, Meta agreed to invest over $14 billion in Scale, valuing the company at $29 billion.

Alexandr joined us on the Lightcone to share how Scale evolved from a scrappy YC startup into the backbone of some of the world's most advanced AI systems, how he thinks about competition with Chinese AI labs, and what it takes to build infrastructure that shapes the frontier.

Apply to Y Combinator: https://ycombinator.com/apply
Work at a startup: https://workatastartup.com

Chapters (Powered by https://ChapterMe.co):

37:37 Agentic workflows 
41:55 “Humanity’s Last Exam”
47:48 U.S. vs China in AI and hard tech
56:57 How to be hardcore

author: @Wallstreetpaper

video_title: Alexandr Wang: Building Scale AI, Transforming Work With Agents & Competing With China
author: @Hall
comment:
Here are some tips for entrepreneurs:

• Focus on problems: Early on, Scale AI focused on the narrow problem of self-driving cars (8:19).
• Be aware of market size: Focusing on self-driving cars enabled quick scaling, but wasn't a large enough market to sustain a gigantic business (9:51).
• Generate data for AI applications: To be successful in any vertical area, AI needs data, so demand for those products would precede the evolution of AI into those industries ().
• Find repetitive human workflows: Identify repetitive human workflows and convert that into data sets that enable building automation tools ().
• Care: The biggest thing is you just have to really, really, really care ().

video_title: AI가 우리의 기억력, 업무, 사회생활을 어떻게 향상시킬 수 있을까 | 톰 그루버
author: Uploader(Desc)
comment:
How smart can our machines make us? Tom Gruber, co-creator of Siri, wants to make "humanistic AI" that augments and collaborates with us instead of competing with (or replacing) us. He shares his vision for a future where AI helps us achieve superhuman performance in perception, creativity and cognitive function -- from turbocharging our design skills to helping us remember everything we've ever read and the name of everyone we've ever met. "We are in the middle of a renaissance in AI," Gruber says. "Every time a machine gets smarter, we get smarter."

Check out more TED talks: http://www.ted.com

The TED Talks channel features the best talks and performances from the TED Conference, where the world's leading thinkers and doers give the talk of their lives in 18 minutes (or less). Look for talks on Technology, Entertainment and Design -- plus science, business, global issues, the arts and more.

Follow TED on Twitter:   / tedtalks  
Like TED on Facebook:   / ted
