author: @Knackbacke
comment:
What i took away from this: First, Siri is only useful for people who are not able to use electronic devices without it.

When a doctor is responsible for diagnosing cancer he will try his best and reach a success-rate of 96.6 %. If you design a machine that does the job almost as good as a human there is a chance that the doctor doesn`t FEEL the significance of own skills and RELYS on the machine to do the job. Why use my own brain to sum up numbers when i can use a calculator? Why remember how to write a difficult word when I can just use auto-correct anyways? 

As far as I know humans perceive the world based on what's important to them. I don't remember the name of my neighbours great grandmother because it's not relevant to me. If we mess with our information-filter I fear there is a danger of not being able to make decisions anymore, maybe even developing an identity disorder?

English is not my native language but i hope you get what I'm trying to point out. Any thoughts on this?

author: @vorlonagent
comment:
Two problems just off the bat.

1) AI's sharing my knowledge and memories is scary personal, scary invasive when we consider advertisers and worse government.  

2) The inception (iused intentionally) of foreign memories and concepts into a  brain.  If we can restore a set of memories to an alzehimer's patient, can we convince someone to genuinely think they're someone else?  or make dissent from government literally unthinkable?  Or be bombarded by impulses to buy product X?

maybe we can educate a child is say 5 years but would you like them to come out with a standardized set of beliefs as well as a standardized knowledge set?

Keep large organizations out of my head, thankyouverymuch.  I'm sure I'll sound horse-and-buggy old fashioned in 50 years too...

I don’t really agree with this. I’ve talked to around 300 people working in tech, and the reality is that big companies like Microsoft, Google, Amazon, and Meta are still doing layoffs. The market is really unstable, and landing a job now is much harder than before.
There might be more roles in AI, like machine learning engineers, but overall, competition is extremely high across the entire tech industry. Everyone is fighting for fewer positions, and the interview processes have become super tough.
So yeah, while AI may be shifting the job landscape, it’s definitely not making it easier to get hired.

video_title: The Future of Work: High-Paying Careers That AI Won't Replace
author: @TiSIWO
comment: They are not hiring ppl. They are adjusting skill set, now that the mission is getting clearer. A Theoretical Physicist may be deeply involved in the early stages of a project’s R&D when it was a Scientific problem, but as key issues are fully identified and slowly being resolved, the nature of the problem is slowly becoming an Engineering problem, an an Applied Physicist may be in higher demand. So. Google, Meta, Anthropic, etc are adjusting their skill pools. Be careful.

author: @marcin3136
comment:
100k???
No thx…
I have a job and freedom (I work where- and whenever I want ;)))

* Which type of work cannot be replaced by AI and is the best-paid???

AI strategist-philosopher (a “Renaissance Man”), because this person sets the direction and implements the entire transformation in the world (holistically: culture, science, mentoring, etc.).

How much would they earn?

I estimate up to 10 billion/ year.
But there is also a paradox- such change takes a lot of time, so it becomes an auction (“the pioneer’s advantage”; we currently have a “blue ocean theory,” meaning that whoever “positions themselves correctly” at the beginning will be setting the rules for the next 50- 100 years, just like it was with BMW/ Mercedes/ Siemens/ etc.).

author: @eddielim3909
comment: I’ve been a Project Manager and Program Manager for almost 20 years but about 6 years ago, my company moved fully to agile delivery where we stop doing project delivery hence I had to change a lot of my traditionally PM activities to adapt and purely lead agile teams by provide coaching and advice. I’ve learnt to use tool like Jira to an advanced level where I can create delivery plan, strategy roadmap, dashboard, status report and executive summary using live data with very little effort once setup. Recent AI agents that my company implemented made these tasks even more easy and I can do even more sophisticated strategic planning and velocity tuning with suggestive data insights. I can’t even say I’m a Project Manager when I’m being asked these day as I hardly do much of the traditional PM tasks. Someone recently said I’m more of a delivery advisor or coach

video_title: 요즘 개발자 특징 | 더이상 코딩 배우지 마세요| 바이브 코딩
author: @chakan81
comment:
최근 들어 chatgpt 도 써보고 cursor 도 써보고 하는 중인데 node.js 1도 모르는 상태에서 react 랑 fastapi, postgre 로 작동하는 서비스 프로토타입 만드는데 4시간 정도면 가능함. 디자인 진짜 안 이쁘지만 일단 필수 기능 작동하게 가능함. 근데 얘가 한 60% 정도 되면 그때부터 헛소리를 시작함. a 가 문제라서 오류가 나는데 자꾸 b, c 가 문제라면서 엉뚱한거 고침. 그렇게 30분 정도 삽질하다가 야 지금 a가 문제인거 아니야? 하면 아! 좋은 지적입니다. 이러면서 그제서야 제대로 고치기 시작함... 결론은 문제가 생기면 어디가 문제일까 정도는 예측할 수 있어야 원하는 방향으로 만들 수 있는거 같음. 그리고 일단 완성하고 나면 이게 어떻게 돌아가는지 뜯어볼 엄두가 안 남... 리팩토링은 엄두도 안 남... ;ㅁ;

참고로 애가 좀 많이 해멘다 싶을 때는 "처음부터 찬찬히 다시 한번 생각해보자." 하면 전체 구조부터 시작해서 다시 점검하면서 문제점 찾긴 함. 그래도 좀만 복잡해지면 여전히 어리버리.....

video_title: 요즘 개발자 특징 | 더이상 코딩 배우지 마세요| 바이브 코딩
author: @sam366326
comment:
저는 개발자는 아니지만 게임 VFX일하고 있는데요
이쪽의 종착지는 TA가 되는 경우가 많아서 언제나 코딩에 관심이 있었습니다.
근데 얼마전에 GPT에게 일하다 불편한 부분을 코딩 시켜보고 많이 놀랐어요
진짜로 개발자에게 부탁하지 않고도 스스로 처리 할 수 있게 된 거죠

바이브 코딩으로 배운다고 진또배기 개발자가 못되는 건 아닌 것 같아요
저는 AI에게 코드를 받고나서 항상 이 코드를 전부 초등학생에게 설명하는 것과 같이 쓰인 기능과 연산에 대해 자세히 설명해달라고 하거든요
그러면 기능과 연산 같은 지식들을 학습 할 수 있게되고, AI가 실수 하더라도 배운것들을 떠올려 이렇게 하면 되지않아? 하면서 다시 시키거나 직접 수정을 할 수 있죠.
또 AI가 한번에 처리 못하는 코딩은 만들고자하는  것을 파악해서 부분부분 시킬 수 있게 되구요.

예전에 코딩 기초라고 해서 처음부터 시작하면 텍스트출력 만들고.. 계산기 만들고..
도저히 이걸 응용해서 어떻게 게임 개발에 응용하냐 싶어서 진도가 안 나갔던 것들이 한번에 해결 됐습니다.
정말 신세계입니다. 일을 하면서 동시에 학습까지 되고 있어요 전과는 비교도 안되는 속도로.

comment: 코드 결과에 대해서 책임을 지는 상황을 생각하면.. 여전히 개발자가 우세하겠네요

video_title: 요즘 개발자 특징 | 더이상 코딩 배우지 마세요| 바이브 코딩
author: @히잉-b3x
comment:
저는 개발자는 아니고 바이러스 분석하는 일을 하는 사람인데
논문쓰다가 데이터 너무커지고 그거 분석하는거 너무 시간많이걸리는데 그런곳에 쓰는 프로그램은 없고... 그러다 시도해본게 ai로 코드짜서 쓰니까 넘 편해서 아예 프로그램으로 만드는데 하나도 모르는 상태서 하다보니 하나하나 만드는데 문제해결에 조금 시간이 많이 걸리더라구요. 어디서 문제 발생하는지 계속 실행하면서 생각 계속해서 여기가 문제아니냐 저기가 아니냐 이렇게 접근하면 안되냐 이런식으로 접근 했어요. 다른 ai모델한테도 물어보고 서로 참고? 하게해서 고치고 조금씩 만들어가고는 있는데 확실히 기본 공부가 안되 있으니까 느려요 디버깅에서도 시간 많이 걸려요. 코드 하나하나 처음부터 배워서 만들기에는 또 시간이 많이 걸리니 이렇게 하고 있는데 뭔가 하다보니 어디서 명령을받아 어디로 넘어가고하는지 감? 을 조금씩 잡긴하더라구요. 사용자와 상호작용이 정말 어렵더라구요.. ㅜ 내가 쓰면서 버그나 이런거 다 찾으면서 해보니까 애착 없으면 제대로 버그 못 찾을거같아요. ㅎㅎㅎ

저는 프로그램 개발 모르느까 ai한테 개발프로젝트 섹션을 만들고 섹션내부에서 세션 분리해서 추후 방향이랑 내가 생각하는거 계속 메모겸 업데이트 하면서 각 기능별로 서로 다른 세션에서 작업을 해요. 하나에서만 작업하면 대화랑 코드주고받는게 너무 길어져서 답변에도 오래걸리더라구요. 처음에 프로젝트가 아닌 일반세션에서 하다가 그렇게 되서 다른 세션가니 작업내용을 애가 기억을 잘 못해서 다시 설명하는거 때문에 애먹기도 했어요. 
확실히 기존 개발자들이 ai이용하면 정말 빠르겟구나 하고 느꼈어요.

author: @Lia__17-k8j
comment:
잘 봤습니다. 그런데 영상에서 보여준 task들은 전부 무언가를 생성하는 작업들이고, 가상의 제품을 이용한 예시라 hallucination 문제가 크게 드러나지 않은 것 같습니다. 하지만 실제 활용에서는 어느 정도의 정확도로 조사하고 자료를 작성할 수 있는지가 핵심일 것 같습니다.
어차피 기존 Gemini 모델을 기반으로 한다면, 환각 발생 수준도 기존 모델과 유사할 것 같기는 한데.. 원래라면 딥리서치 결과를 사람이 검토한 뒤 다음 단계(이미지·영상 생성)로 넘어가는 과정에서 잘못된 정보를 걸러낼 수 있었을텐데, 이번 방식은 그런 검증 절차가 없다보니 초기에는 작은 환각이었던 것이 최종 결과물에서는 큰 오류로 확대될 가능성도 있어보이네요. 
hallucination이 생겨서 결과가 이상해지면 전체 시나리오를 다시 돌려야할텐데 사용량이 어느정도까지 될지도 궁금합니다.

video_title: Google's Gemini 3.0: The Most Powerful LLM Ever
author: Uploader(Desc)
comment:
Get a private, on-screen walkthrough of Google’s new Gemini 3.0 with Logan Kilpatrick from Google Deepmind. We vibe-code full apps, games, and product UIs in real time. You’ll see how to go from raw idea to working product in a single prompt, then iterate visually with design, features, and AI workflows. They turn an IdeaBrowser concept into a live talent-matching platform, screenshot-clone the IdeaBrowser UI, wire up a “generate tomorrow’s idea” feature grounded in Google Search, and even add co-founder matching on top. If you’re building with AI or still on the fence, this episode shows what’s now possible with Gemini 3.0 Pro in AI Studio.

Timestamps
00:00 – Intro
01:00 – What Gemini 3 is and where it lives (Gemini app, AI Studio, API)
03:03 – Vibe Coding 3D games
09:27 – Vibe Coding an idea from IdeaBrowser
25:02 – Screenshot-cloning the IdeaBrowser UI and regenerating it in Gemini

Key Points
Gemini 3.0 Pro in AI Studio lets you “vibe code” full apps—UI, logic, and AI features—from natural-language prompts, then iteratively refine them.
Games and complex simulations are a stress-test and showcase for the model’s capabilities, not just toys.
You can paste an entire business idea (like IdeaBrowser’s generational talent-matching concept) into AI Studio and get a working, multi-screen product with AI-powered workflows.
Gemini 3.0 Pro is free to use inside AI Studio up to generous limits, and the API is priced at $2 per million input tokens and $12 per million output tokens under 200K input tokens.
Screenshot-driven UI cloning plus “add five more features” prompts are powerful loops for product and UX ideation.
You can layer social features like co-founder matching directly on top of idea-discovery products with only a few additional prompts.
Section Summaries

1) Why Gemini 3.0 Is an “Unfair Advantage”
Greg frames the episode as an inside look at Google’s new Gemini 3.0, promising listeners a practical “unfair advantage” in how to use it. Logan explains Gemini 3’s mission—helping you “bring anything to life,” from receipts and papers to app ideas—and outlines where it’s available: the Gemini app, AI Studio, and APIs for developers and enterprises. 

2) Vibe Coding Landing Pages and Games
Inside AI Studio’s vibe-coding experience, Logan shows that a single prompt can generate polished landing pages and immersive 3D games. They discuss games as both marketing assets (e.g., branded runners for companies) and as a proxy for the model’s sophistication, since game logic and UX are hard to build by hand. 

3) Turning an IdeaBrowser Concept into a Working App
Greg introduces an IdeaBrowser concept: a generational gap talent-matching platform pairing junior AI developers with senior industry veterans. Logan copies the idea’s full text into AI Studio and asks Gemini to “make it fully functional,” resulting in a live app with landing page, talent profiles, fit analysis, and an enterprise team-builder that evaluates roster balance. 

4) Debugging, Annotating, and Deploying Vibe-Coded Apps
As they explore, they hit common vibe-coding friction points: a mis-placed “Send” button and a blank preview due to missing files. Logan demonstrates the annotate tool (boxing UI elements and attaching instructions) and the simple fix of telling the model “the screen is white” so it regenerates the correct structure, then describes how you can deploy, share, and iterate on these apps with teammates or customers. 

5) Screenshot-Cloning IdeaBrowser and Generating Tomorrow’s Ideas
They screenshot IdeaBrowser’s UI and ask Gemini to “clone this UI exactly” while adding a “generate tomorrow’s idea” button grounded in Google Search. The model recreates a close visual match and builds a feature that pulls current AI governance trends to generate a new idea (“Ethos AI”) with positioning, offer, and starter kit concepts—showing how screenshots become launchpads for new verticals or geos. 

The #1 tool to find startup ideas/trends - https://www.ideabrowser.com/

LCA helps Fortune 500s and fast-growing startups build their future - from Warner Music to Fortnite to Dropbox. We turn 'what if' into reality with AI, apps, and next-gen products https://latecheckout.agency/

author: @VaughnRhodes
comment:
If you really want to build your own app, and have it be more than a brief semi-functional amusement: DON'T DO IT THE WAY SHOWN HERE! It might SORT-OF work, and be KINDA-LIKE what you want, but when you then try to refine it and adjust it to be closer to what you really want, you'll run into all kinds of problems. 

Instead, start with getting clear on the detailed requirements for your app: have a discussion with the AI about it. Start with your description of what you want, ask it what's missing, what's not clear, what would it suggest improving. Have it ask you questions. Keep iterating on the requirements description until you  get something very clear and detailed. 

THEN ask the AI to build the app, and iterate from there.

video_title: Google's Gemini 3.0: The Most Powerful LLM Ever
author: @youtubrooo
comment:
I’ve been seeing a bunch of friends using Gemini 3 Pro to spin up apps with basically one sentence. People get amazed that such a tiny prompt can generate something that actually runs.
To me, that’s not really the surprising part. When you give an AI almost no requirements, it just fills in the gaps however it wants — and honestly that’s the easy mode.
What’s actually hard is getting it to build EXACTLY what you intended, with well-defined, detailed requirements.
But the truth is, most of the time we can’t think through every little detail upfront. And if we keep adding or correcting things along the way, the app usually turns into a BIG messy pile of code that only works if you get lucky.
So I’ve been doing something kind of counterintuitive: even when I’m not totally sure what I want, I just let the AI build its own version first.
Then, by looking at what it came up with, I suddenly realize — ohh, THAT’s what I actually meant. After that, I just toss all that code out and write a much cleaner plan for the real thing.
This used to be unrealistic because rewriting everything was too expensive. But now that code is basically FREE, starting over doesn’t hurt at all.

comment:
Nice video :)

My suggesstion:
Actual result is not necessary. If test case is failed you will be changing the status of it. Once bug fixed, u will retest the test case and change the status to pass.
Test case name is missing in this.
Test description - by the name we can understand that it should be descriptive. So elobrate the test case description.

video_title: Unit Testing with examples in Software Engineering
author: @alexanderpetranov
comment:
Key points:
Unit testing is used to test induvidual pieces of code of the program to make sure they work properly on their own before putting them together. Think of testning individual parts of a car before putting them together to build the car.

In procedural languages each procedure is a unit. In object-oriented languages each class or object is a unit

video_title: We’ve Lost Control of AI
author: Uploader(Desc)
comment:
If you find these trends concerning and you want to make a difference, you can go to http://controlai.com/scishow, where ControlAI has created tools to help you easily voice your concerns to your lawmakers in less than a minute. ControlAI is a non-profit working to keep humanity in control of AI by mobilizing everyone from concerned citizens to experts to raise awareness of the risks of superintelligence and push for international action to address them.

Artificial intelligence is making its way into every corner of our world. But when leaders in the AI space raise concerns, it's helpful to know what they're worried about. Here's how AI works today.

comment: I had a horrifying experience when I was sending an ambulance for someone, and got an AI dispatcher. I've encountered AI answering services that transfer you to a person when you say you need an ambulance, but this was a complete dispatch with an AI dispatcher. It actually went as smooth as with a human dispatcher. And that's the horrifying part. One day, in the not too distant future, you will call 911 cuz your grandma is having a heart attack, or some psycho is shooting up your grocery store, and you're gonna talk to a robot. For the entire call.

video_title: Creating in Flow | How to use Google’s new AI Filmmaking Tool
author: @chariots8x230
comment: There are some functionality issues that I hope you guys fix. One issue that needs to be corrected is where the AI mixes up different characters’ lines in scenes that have multiple characters. The AI is unable to tell the characters apart, so sometimes it will have one character say the lines of the other character, and vice versa. I’d like to be able to work with ‘Image to Video’, have the ability to clearly point out to the AI which character is which to avoid mixups, specify a unique voice for each of my consistent characters, and have that character’s voice stay the same in every generation, instead of changing every time. Additionally, there is an issue where characters sometimes don’t say their full lines, and the video gets cut short without the character saying all of their lines. This really needs to be fixed, because we don’t want to end up with wasted videos.

video_title: Creating in Flow | How to use Google’s new AI Filmmaking Tool
author: @DjDrakou
comment:
With 2000 credits — meaning 100 VEO3 generations — I only managed to produce three 30-second clips and one 16-second clip that were truly usable. I'm not criticizing the technology itself, which is an impressive achievement (kudos to the team!), but rather the monetization model, which seems a bit excessive in its current form.

A system based on 100 generations would be fine if the success rate was around 90%. But when you’re dealing with only 30–40% of usable outputs, that’s a lot of money burned with little to show for it. And that’s not even considering the learning curve that naturally comes with a brand-new tool, or the lack of official technical documentation from Google to help creators get started efficiently.

It feels a bit harsh, especially at this price point. I sincerely hope Google will adjust its pricing model or provide better support and transparency moving forward.

That said, the tool is very promising, and it’s clearly just getting started. Super impressive, and I’m excited to see how it evolves!

comment:
Dear Team,

I am a subscriber of the Ultra plan and would like to report a recurring issue. I have noticed that more than 70% of the videos generated are coming with problems, which significantly impacts the overall experience.

I believe there should be a mechanism to validate whether the output aligns with the original prompt. If the generated video fails to meet at least 70% of the requested content, the corresponding credit should not be deducted.

Furthermore, I recently used the option to include audio in a video, but the result was delivered without any sound. In such cases, I believe it would be fair to automatically refund the credits used.

Thank you for your attention, and I look forward to a resolution so that I may continue using the service with confidence and satisfaction.

video_title: Our latest artificial intelligence reports | 60 Minutes Full Episodes
author: Uploader(Desc)
comment:
From April, a look at what's next for AI at Google DeepMind. From December, a story on Khanmigo, the AI tutor for students. From May, a story about the "digital bridge" helping paralyzed patients. From December, a report on the harm of AI "nudify" sites that create fake nudes. From November, a look at how training AI takes a toll on Kenyan workers. And from May, reports on the future of warfare.

#news #artificialintelligence #technology 

"60 Minutes" is the most successful television broadcast in history. Offering hard-hitting investigative reports, interviews, feature segments and profiles of people in the news, the broadcast began in 1968 and is still a hit, over 50 seasons later, regularly making Nielsen's Top 10.

video_title: 코딩할 줄 몰라도 다 된다... AI가 연 '바이브 코딩'과 로우코드/노코드 부상, 진짜 개발자는 없어지나?
author: Uploader(Desc)
comment:
인공지능 코딩 보조 기술인 '바이브 코딩'과 로우코드/노코드 도구의 부상으로 소프트웨어 개발 방식이 근본적으로 변화하고 있습니다. 테슬라와 OpenAI에서 활동한 안드레이 카파시가 제시한 바이브 코딩은 AI에게 자연어로 지시하여 프로그램을 만드는 새로운 코딩 방식입니다. 이는 GPT-4, LLaMA 같은 초거대 언어 모델이 방대한 데이터로 학습되어 가능해졌습니다. 대표적인 AI 코딩 도구인 Cursor AI나 GitHub Copilot은 코드 생성 및 수정, 버그 해결 보조 등을 통해 개발 생산성을 크게 높이고 있습니다. AI가 코딩 작업 속도를 평균 55%까지 빠르게 하지만, 개발자는 AI가 생성한 코드를 검토하고 통합하는 데 더 많은 시간을 할애하기도 합니다. 한편, 로우코드/노코드 플랫폼은 적은 코드 또는 코드 작성 없이도 애플리케이션 제작을 가능하게 하여 개발의 민주화를 목표로 합니다. 이는 개발 인력 부족과 소프트웨어 수요 증가 문제를 해결하고, 현업과 개발자 간 소통을 원활하게 하는 대안으로 주목받고 있습니다. 가트너에 따르면 글로벌 로우코드/노코드 시장은 고속 성장 중이며, Microsoft Power Platform과 같은 플랫폼은 이미 수천만 명의 사용자를 확보했습니다. 흥미롭게도 로우코드 툴의 주요 사용자는 오히려 전문 개발자들이며, 비개발자의 활용도 AI 통합으로 점차 쉬워지고 있습니다. 이러한 변화는 개발자의 역할을 단순 코딩에서 벗어나 설계, 관리, AI와의 협업 중심으로 변화시킬 것입니다. 개발자는 AI의 산출물을 검토하고 조정하는 디렉터나 품질관리자 역할을 수행하며, 기본기 강화와 함께 인간 고유의 문제 해결 및 설계 역량이 더욱 중요해집니다. 결국 AI 코딩 보조와 로우코드/노코드 도구를 능동적으로 받아들이고 자신의 역량을 재정비하는 개발자가 이 변화의 시대에 가치 있는 인재로 남을 것입니다.

Written by Error
Edited by 이지호

author: @lovegpt_googleplay
comment: 코드 길어지고 복잡도 올라갈수록 기술부채가 쌓이는게 문제입니다  하지만 간단한 프로그램은 충분히구현가능할듯합니다  시간지나서 더 발전하면 엄청복잡한 프로그램도 가능할거같긴한데 지금은 아직 보조도구 수준인듯해요

video_title: 코딩할 줄 몰라도 다 된다... AI가 연 '바이브 코딩'과 로우코드/노코드 부상, 진짜 개발자는 없어지나?
author: @sjohn9412
comment:
13년차 개발자 현 ai 개발자.
진짜 맞다이 까면 내가 더 잘할 수 있을거 같다가도, 쓰다보니까 점점 떠남기는 영역이 많고
이제 코드를 읽는게 슬슬 귀찮아짐. 디버깅은 이제 거의 ai 전담임...
하나씩 내 영역을 넘기는데 점점 잘해진다 얘가..
6개월에 한번씩 정말 깜짝깜짝 놀람.. 왜냐? 분명히 6개월전엔 이거 못했거든..
근데 더 놀라운건 이제 정말 간단한 코드도 잘 기억이 안난다.. 하도 떠넘겼더니.
마치 네비없던 시절 서울길 다 외우다가 네비 생기고 길못찾거나
후방감지기 없을때 조수석에 손얹고 폭풍후진 하다가. 이제는 띠띠띠 없으면 거리도 못재게 된것처럼.
1년안에 바이브코딩을 넘어 노코딩 세계로 갈거 같다.

author: @sunghoonjung9570
comment: 저같은 경우는 IT 분야 엔지니어는 아니고 기계공학분야 구조 설계엔지니어인데 아무래도 설계엔지니어는 엑셀이나 코딩을 통해서 각종 설계를 위한 부품의 위치와 크기에 대한 계산을 하는게 핵심이죠. 그런데 이전에는 어떻게 하면 계산을 효율적으로 자동으로 하는지에 대한 대략적인 개념은 머리속에 있는데 막상 코딩을 할줄 몰라서 막히는게 정말로 많았습니다. 그런데 이걸 다 챗지피티나 제미나이에게 단계적으로 구체적인 설명을 하면 제가 필요한 수준에선 웬만한게 다 결과로 나오더군요. 실로 놀라운 수준입니다. 조만간에 여기서 더 발전하면 일반 인공지능이 나올지도 모르는데 아무튼 최근 몇년사이에 인공지능으로 인해서 일하는 방식이 완전히 달라졌습니다.

comment: 다들  비개발자나 아예 모르는 사람은 쓰기 어렵다 하지만 코드에 대해 단 1도 알지 못하는 저도 gpt 프롬프트로 자동 예약 관리 프로그램과 고객 예약 안내 프로그램을 개인 서버와 또 예약관리 api를 만들어내서 제 사업에 사용중인데 확실히 세상이 바뀌긴 한듯.

video_title: 코딩할 줄 몰라도 다 된다... AI가 연 '바이브 코딩'과 로우코드/노코드 부상, 진짜 개발자는 없어지나?

video_title: 코딩할 줄 몰라도 다 된다... AI가 연 '바이브 코딩'과 로우코드/노코드 부상, 진짜 개발자는 없어지나?
author: @하하호호허허드드
comment: 저는 코딩의 코 자도 모르지만 커서로 간단한 웹페이지에 검색 로직까지는 능숙하게 할 수 있었는데요 확실에 코딩의 전문적인 지식이 없으니 유지보수나 더 디테일한 작업은 너무 어렵네요.

video_title: 코딩할 줄 몰라도 다 된다... AI가 연 '바이브 코딩'과 로우코드/노코드 부상, 진짜 개발자는 없어지나?
author: @tkvldpstm84593
comment: 지금은 개발자가 필요함. AI한테 반복 요청해도 계속 빵꾸나는 부분이 있어서 직접 수정하는게 빠름. 근데 당장 그렇다는거고 조만간 완벽해질것같다

video_title: 코딩할 줄 몰라도 다 된다... AI가 연 '바이브 코딩'과 로우코드/노코드 부상, 진짜 개발자는 없어지나?
author: @dongkeunjang2585
comment: 바이브 코딩은 두 가지가 전제되야합니다: 1. AI가 쓴 코드를 읽고 고칠 수 있어야 한다. 2. 내가 AI로 쓴 코드를 같이 일하는 팀 동료 개발자가 읽고 고칠 수 있어야 한다. 이 두가지가 되지 않으면 프로토 타잎 이상은 힘들더라구요.

comment: 저는 비개발직군인데, 기획은 할 줄 알아서 신기해 하면서 했습니다. 계속 수정하니까 요금을 내야한다고 해서 결제하고 진행하는데 또 요금을 다 썼다고 해서 추가해서 하다가 관뒀어요. 이유는, 별로 복잡해보이지 않은 언어 번역을 시켰더니, 다른 사이드이펙이 어마어마하게 발생하네요. 나름대로 파일 찾아가서 소스를 봐도 언어도 다 변경돼 있던데, 프런트에서는 자꾸 국문이랑 혼용되어 나오기도 하고요. 이거 고치면 기존에 다듬었던 로직이 다시 엉망징창이 되어있구요. ㅠㅠ 로직은 하나로만 제어하고 언어 바꿀때마다 영향을 주면 안된다고 말하면, 또 다 알아들었다고 너말이 맞다고 그러면서 맨날 틀려요. ㅠ 저 밤샜어요. ㅠㅠ

video_title: AI 서비스 수익 공개 및 Replit 바이브 코딩으로 '테토 에겐 테스트' 만들기
author: @Spadle0208
comment:
참고로 개발자가 아닌분들은 바이브 코딩시 가장 문제되는 부분이 원하는 방향대로 결과물이 나오지 않거나 문제가 생겼을때 수정하는 부분 입니다.
개발자는 디버깅이 숙명이라는 말 처럼 수정작업이 익숙해서 괜찮지만, 비개발직들은 이걸 해결하기 위해선 플랜을 완벽하게 짜야합니다.
여기 영상에서는 단순한 기본 모델을 단순 프롬프트로 제작하고 그위에 기능을 추가하는 수순이라 단순하게 제작이 되었는데
기능이 복잡하고 완벽도가 높은 서비스일수록 플랜도 완벽해야합니다.
해서, 비개발군이 바이브코딩을 효과적으로 하려면, 일단 ai 에게 계획서를 치밀하게 만들도록 시키고,
그것을 본인이 직접 검토후에 프로토 타입을 만들어보고 플랜을 수정해 나가야 합니다.
마음에 드는 수준의 프로토 타입이 나오면 그때 그 계획서를 들고 제작해달라고 하면 손댈부분이 많이 없습니다.
실제로 바이브코딩을 하시는 개발자 동기들 보면 일단 플랜을 세밀하게 제작시키고 그것에 맞춰 개발을 시킵니다.
개발자가 아니더라도 플랜부터 시키는게 어려운건 아니니 위 방법을 추천드립니다.
플랜만 잘 짜여있으면 만들어진 서비스를 고치는거보다 플랜 수정해서 다시 만들게 시키는게 효과적일때도 있습니다.

author: @manuallenstv5126
comment: 이거 내가 잘못 사용해서 그런지 모르겠지만, 내가 지시한 것도 따르지 않고 지 맘대로 코딩을 하는 과금을 하여 돈벌이 할려는 그런 행태를 보이더라고요. 처음에는 몰라 싸게 사이트를 만들려고 들어 갔다가 돈 좀 털렸습니다. 물론 사이트를 만들기는 했지만 완전 내가 지시하지도 않은 것을 막 실행하고 일부러 틀려서 질문을 다시금 유도하는 돈벌이에만 집착하는 그런 행태라더고요. 물론 Replit라는 회사가 Ai에게 그렇게 프로그래밍했지요. 좀 실망이랄까... 그리고 한번 질문에 얼마라는 그러한 과금 내용도 없고...초자가 멋도 모르고 막 사용했다가 돈 털릴 뿐 했네요.ㅎㅎ 세상은 그렇게 녹녹하지 않다라고 할까... 물론 프로분들은 다르겠지만요 아마추어에게 좀 그런 Ai였습니다. 여기 운영자님은 이런 안좋은 점도 한번 동영상으로 올려서 아마추어 분들이 현혹되지 않도록 해 주었으면 합니다.

comment:
Hey Karthik,  I hope you are doing well.  Like yourself I see ChatGPT as a way to get up and going fast with test automation code.  
A lazy developer might copy/paste code from ChatGPT output but that output is not perfect. 
This enforces the need for test automation, not the other way around.

Further, ChatGPT can write unit tests but I do not think it can write integration or system test automation; hence, there is still a real need for people to fulfill that role.

video_title: (상위1%툴) 구글러들이 쓰는 바이브코딩 툴 "안티그래비티" 출시! AI 에이전트 성능이 미쳤습니다
author: Uploader(Desc)
comment:
🤔 나만 AI 트렌드에서 뒤쳐지는 것 같아 불안하신가요? AI 노코드 마스터클래스에서 지금 바로 시작하세요: https://join.ainocodemasterclass.kr/

여러분, 구글이 미친 게 틀림없습니다. 그동안 월 20달러씩 내고 쓰던 '커서(Cursor)'나 '클로드' 구독을 고민하게 만드는, 구글의 야심작 '안티그래비티(Antigravity)'가 출시되었습니다.

가장 충격적인 건 '가격'과 '성능'입니다. 현재 안티그래비티는 모든 플랜이 무료이며, 심지어 구글의 최신 모델인 제미나이 3 프로(Gemini 3 Pro)까지 무제한으로 사용할 수 있습니다.

기존에는 리눅스 설치 등 복잡한 과정이 필요했던 에이전트 코딩을 윈도우에서도 클릭 몇 번으로 설치할 수 있고 , AI 에이전트가 인터넷 검색부터 코드 작성, 브라우저 테스트까지 '알아서' 수행합니다.

오늘 영상에서는 안티그래비티의 설치부터, 제미나이 3 프로를 활용해 랜딩 페이지를 순식간에 리디자인하는 '바이브 코딩' 실전까지 모두 담았습니다. 유료화되기 전에 지금 바로 경험해보세요!

[영상 핵심 요약]
🚀 Gemini 3 Pro 무제한: 월 결제 없이 최고 성능 AI 모델 사용
💸 Cursor 대체 가능?: 설치부터 사용법까지 완벽 가이드
🤖 자율주행 에이전트: 코드 작성부터 웹사이트 테스트까지 자동화
🎨 바이브 코딩: 디자인 몰라도 말로 다 되는 웹사이트 제작

20년 전 처음 객체 지향을 배우고 UML로 설계를 시작하면서 꿈에 그리던 세상이 오고 있는 거 같네요.

author: @wegaia
comment:
다운로드 받을려고 들어가려는데 사이트가 연결이 안되네요. 다들 미친듯이 다운로드 받으러 간 듯. 
뭣보다 컨텍스트 윈도우 사이즈가 1백만인게 너무 좋을 듯. 
썩을 클로드 코드는 20만이라 작업 좀 할만하면 토큰 다 찼다고 해서 세션 이어갈려니 문서화도 시도하고 메모리 레이어도 시도하고 딱 이러고 있었는데 이젠 그냥 제미나이 3 써야 할듯. 
물론 코딩을 얼마나 잘 하나는 좀 봐야될 듯. 
아직도 코딩 능력은 살짝 클로드가 높던데.

comment:
🚀 Become a Python Developer with No Degree - https://academy.internetmadecoder.com...

Build these simple beginner Python projects to practice your Python skills and bolster your portfolio.

Python is one of the most powerful programming languages out there due to its versatility and the prevalence of libraries to achieve all sorts of interesting things.

These are some examples of Python scripting projects you can do as a beginner very easily to see the power of the Python programming language and learn to code in the process.

I also teach the basics of zsh shell scripting to make running these programs from your terminal window even easier.

author: Uploader(Desc)
comment:
Learn how to automate your life with Python! You will learn how to automate boring and repetitive tasks such as creating an Excel report, sending text messages, extracting tables from websites, interacting with websites, and more. You will learn how to use a few different Python libraries to help with automation such as Path, Selenium, XPath, and more.

💻 Source Code & Datasets: https://github.com/ifrankandrade/auto...

✏️ Course from Frank Andrade. Check out his YouTube Channel:    / frankandrade5  
🔗 Automation Cheat Sheet: https://artificialcorner.com/p/redeem...
🔗 Frank's 11-Hour Automation Course in Python: https://www.udemy.com/course/automate...
🔗 Frank's Discord Server:   / discord  

❤️ Try interactive Python courses we love, right in your browser: https://scrimba.com/freeCodeCamp-Python (Made possible by a grant from our friends at Scrimba)

video_title: 초보자를 위한 15가지 훌륭한 IoT 프로젝트!
author: Uploader(Desc)
comment:
이 영상에는 초보자를 위한 15가지 멋진 IoT 프로젝트가 담겨 있습니다. 저희 채널을 구독하시면 좋은 프로젝트 아이디어를 놓치지 않으실 수 있습니다.

Altium Designer 무료 체험판을 받아보세요:
https://www.altium.com/yt/topprojects...

올인원 전자 제품 설계 플랫폼, Altium 365를 만나보세요:
https://www.altium.com/altium-365

Octopart에서 최고 품질의 부품을 만나보세요:
https://www.octopart.com

PCBA $0부터 (무료 설치, 무료 스텐실), 신규 사용자 $54 쿠폰 받기:
https://jlcpcb.com/?from=TPC

JLCPCB 소개:
JLCPCB는 업계 최고의 고객 경험을 통해 신뢰성 높고 비용 효율적인 PCB를 신속하게 생산하는 선도적인 글로벌 PCB 제조업체입니다.

Altium 소개:
Altium은 업계 최고의 PCB 설계 소프트웨어로, 회로도, 레이아웃 등 인쇄 회로 기판을 손쉽게 설계하는 데 필요한 모든 것을 하나의 환경에 통합합니다.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
면책 조항: 이 영상에 나오는 모든 프로젝트는 제작자의 독점 재산입니다. 프로젝트를 공유해 주시거나 이 영상에 포함되도록 허락해 주신 모든 제작자분들께 감사드립니다. 아래에서 각 제작자의 전체 프로젝트 영상을 확인하세요.

기술 스택 확인 방법 -    • QnA Friday 34 - How to check TECHNOLOGY ST...  

안녕하세요, Raghav님.

저는 Mustafa입니다. 구독자 중 한 명입니다.

면접관에게 설명하기 위해 제 프로젝트를 시뮬레이션하는 데 도움이 필요합니다. 도와주실 수 있거나, 이 부분을 도와줄 수 있는 선배를 알고 계시면 감사하겠습니다!

세션 비용을 지불할 의향이 있습니다.

—

안녕하세요, Mustafa님.

프로젝트를 직접 생성했거나 프로젝트 생성에 참여했다면 일반적으로 설명할 수 있을 것입니다. 애플리케이션과 프로젝트의 요구 사항부터 시작하여 설정 방법, 구조, 파일, 폴더, 라이브러리 등을 설명하고 기본적인 워크플로우를 설명할 수 있습니다.

video_title: ESP8266 AI를 이용한 홈 자동화(ESP8266 - ESP32) | CADIO 홈 오토메이션
author: Uploader(Desc)
comment:
CADIO Website:
https://egycad.com/cadio/

CADIO Downloads Center:
https://egycad.com/cadio/downloads/

CADIO Developers Docs:
https://egycad.com/cadio/docs/discove...

CADIO Firmware For ESP8266:
https://egycad.com/cadio/docs/firmwar...

CADIO Firmware For ESP32:
https://egycad.com/cadio/docs/firmwar...

Linking CADIO With Google Home:
https://egycad.com/cadio/docs/3rd-par...

Linking CADIO With Amazon Alexa:
https://egycad.com/cadio/docs/3rd-par...

---------------------------------------------------------------

Circuit diagram:
https://egycad.com/uploads/CADIO_23_3...

---------------------------------------------------------------
00:00 Intro
01:03 Install CADIO app
01:25 Install CADIO firmware on ESP8266
02:25 Wiring the components
02:54 Creating the info file and configuration
04:42 Testing the unit
07:16 Linking with Google home and Alexa
07:57 Indicators and config button
09:00 Unit license
09:51 Exploring more CADIO features
---------------------------------------------------------------

If you have an ESP microcontroller in your home, don't miss this video!

In the next few minutes we will build a home automation unit with AI, we will not write any code at all, we will not even use a keyboard!

Our unit will be able to control two bulbs and RGB strip, online and offline using our smartphone, we will be able to control them with RF remote controllers, and of course the regular wall switches.

Our devices will work with ALEXA echo devices, also with Google home.

We will be able to set timers and schedules, receive notifications, and control the devices with our voice.

We will add a digital sensor, and a DHT to measure temperature and humidity, and link them with our devices to create an automation.

All the software will be handled by CADIO platform, we just need to install CADIO firmware on the ESP, and tell CADIO some information about our unit, and boom, job done!

CADIO app is available on google play store for android devices, and apple app store for IOS, we will download CADIO app, and create an account by entering our email address and choosing a password and enter it twice, now we have a CADIO account, we can now configure and link our units to it.

To install CADIO firmware on ESP8266, we need to download the latest CADIO firmware, and the ESP flash download tool, all these files can be downloaded from CADIO downloads center.

Now we open the ESP flash download tool and select ESP8266, then select the firmware file and set the address to 0x0, set the flash mode to DIO and the speed to 40MHz, then select the port, and click erase to clear the ESP flash from any stored data.

After erasing the flash we click start to download the firmware on the Esp.

and when downloading is done, we reset the ESP, and after seconds.. CADIO firmware will be installed and the ESP will be ready for receiving the info file.

we can build units with any architecture we want, in this unit I have connected 2 relays to GPIO4 and 5, 2 switches to GPIO12 and 14, addressable RGB to GPIO15, DHT to GPIO10, and a digital sensor to GPIO3, I'm using an IR sensor, I have connected also RF receiver module to GPIO13.

After CADIO firmware is installed on the ESP, the ESP will create a WIFI network for receiving the info file and configuration.

We open the CADIO app and go to the configuration section, and connect the phone to the ESP WIFI network, in seconds, the connection will establish and the info file page will appear.

The Info file page will create the info file based on our preferences, and all codes will be internally created with the power of AI.

now I will tell CADIO about my unit, for example, my relays module is active-low, so I will set relays mode to active-low, my unit has a 433 Megahertz RF receiver, so I will activate the 433 Megahertz and select the GPIO.

In the devices table, I will add my devices and select their GPIOs, 2 on off devices, RGB, DHT, and a sensor, and simply select their GPIOs.

then I will send the info file to the ESP.

Now the configuration page appears, all we need to do is enter our home router WIFI network details, so our unit can connect to the internet.

After saving the configuration, the unit will start scanning networks, and connecting to our home network, and connect to the internet, and appear in the application interface.

and now our unit is ready!

아,운전한다고 귀가 번쩍 뜨이네 하시니까 저도 생각나네요.
애플 뮤직에서 플레이리스트 이름을 단자리 말고 23,24,이런식으로 만들어 두시면
운전중에 시리로 플레이 리스트 변경 할 수 있습니다.
아예 음악을 안틀고 딴걸 하고 있더라도
"시리야.플레이리스트23 재생"이러면 재생 되고
다른거 듣고 싶으면 다른 플레이리스트 이름 말하면 되고요.
숫자로 하라는 이유가 단어면 그 단어랑 헷갈려서 인식을 엉뚱하게
할때가 있어서 그게 제일 편하더라고요.

video_title: HTTP 요청 응답 헤더 튜토리얼 상세 설명 | HTTP 헤더 튜토리얼
author: Uploader(Desc)
comment:
This is a presentation on HTTP Headers. In this tutorial you will learn about HTTP Request and response headers from basics in detail. I have exlain http request and http response flows. You will learn the following:

What are HTTP Headers?
Why HTTP Headers are used?
How these headers are used?
Tools to use for debugging
Different Request Headers
Different Response Headers

If you wants to learn about HTTP in detail then you should refer the following
   • HTTP [Hypetext Transport Protocol] tutoria...  

We will talk about the following Request headers:
Accept
Accept-Charset
Accept-Encoding
Accept-Language
Authorization
Cache-Control
Connection
Cookie
Content-Length
Content-Type
Date
Host
If-Modified-Since
If-Unmodified-Since
If-Match
If-None-Match
Pragma
Range
User-Agent
Via
X-Forwarded For


Then we will learn about following Response Headers
Access-Control-Allow-Origin
Accept-Ranges
Age
Allow
Cache-Control
Connection
Content-Disposition
Content-Encoding
Content-Language
Content-Length
Content-Type
Date
Etag
Expires
Last-Modified
Location
Retry-After
Server
Set-Cookie
Transfer-Encoding
Vary
Via
WWW-Authenticate
Strict-Transport-Security

author: Uploader(Desc)
comment:
What is Data Pipeline | How to design Data Pipeline? - ETL vs Data pipeline
#datapipeline 

📢📢 Subscribe to my FREE newsletter "Normal I.T. Guy" to know more about what I am thinking, learning and doing in my career & life !!
CLICK THE LINK BELOW 👇👇👇
https://anshultiwari.substack.com 

**Do check out our popular playlists**

1) Latest technology tutorial (2020) - 
   • What is a Data Vault ? | 3NF vs Dimensiona...  

2) Google Cloud Platform Beginner Series (2020) -
   • Google Cloud Platform (GCP) - Beginner Ser...  

3) Crunching Data Series (2020) -    • Learn - Data Engineering, Data Architectur...  

Hi Friends, I am Anshul Tiwari, and welcome to our youtube channel              I.T. k Funde.

More about this video -  
In this video, we will understand what is a data pipeline with the help of a real-life example. Data pipelines are designed to move data from one point to another. In this video, we will cover below topics -

1 - What is a Data Pipeline?
2 - Why you need a data pipeline?
3 - Basic design of a data pipeline
4 - Types of Data Pipeline - Batch, Streaming, Lambda architecture
5 -  Advanced data pipeline design

We will also learn about various products that can be used in a data pipeline - SAP BODS, Mongo DB, Apache Kafka, Big Query, MDM, Teradata, SAP Business Objects, Tableau.

Credits & Resources -
Wikipedia
https://www.alooma.com/blog/what-is-a...

author: @bigglesharrumpher4139
comment: Great video - it seems while technology has advanced, the concepts of batch loads and real-time data is actually decades old. Back in early 2000's we controlled all ETL and real-time loads with Unix or DOS or SQL scripts that provided return codes for success/failure which triggered alert emails, and we had KPI's for Data quality, backing-out jobs for failed loads, and many other control systems. It just seems there are more 'out-of-the-box' software to handle these now as opposed to custom-built solutions. Great presentation!

video_title: 초보자를 위한 데이터 엔지니어링 과정
author: Uploader(Desc)
comment:
Learn the essentials of data engineering in this course for beginners. You'll learn about Databases, Docker, and analytical engineering. You'll explore advanced topics like data pipeline building with Airflow, and engage in batch processing with Spark and streaming data with Kafka. The course culminates in a comprehensive project, putting your skills to the test in creating a full end-to-end pipeline. 

✏️ Justin Chau created this course. 

Course Resources: https://transparent-trout-f2f.notion....

Thanks to Airbyte for providing a grant to make this course possible.

❤️ Try interactive Databases courses we love, right in your browser: https://scrimba.com/freeCodeCamp-Data... (Made possible by a grant from our friends at Scrimba)


⭐️ Contents ⭐️
⌨️ (0:00:00) Introduction
⌨️ (0:00:36) Why Data Engineering
⌨️ (0:03:14) Docker
⌨️ (0:30:38) SQL
⌨️ (1:04:32) Building a Data Pipeline from Scratch

⌨️ (2:41:14) Airbyte

author: @1001pepi
comment:
At 1:53:56 you may face an error due to the fact that the dbt service is launched before the completion of the elt_script service. 

To solve the issue, you have to add condition: service_completed_successfully under the depends_on clause of the dbt service to be sure that it will always be launched after the completion of the elt_script service.

Airflow와 Python을 활용한 엔드투엔드 데이터 엔지니어링 프로젝트입니다. 이 프로젝트에서는 Twitter API를 사용하여 데이터를 추출하고, Python을 사용하여 데이터를 변환하고, Airflow/EC2에 코드를 배포하고, 최종 결과를 Amazon S3에 저장합니다.

video_title: 10분 만에 Apache Airflow 배우기 | 데이터 엔지니어를 위한 고소득 기술
author: @vijayshreevaibhav
comment:
00:05 A data engineer builds data pipelines to extract, transform, and load data onto a target location.
01:50 Apache Airflow is a viral and widely adopted open-source project for managing data pipelines.
03:33 A workflow in Apache Airflow is called a DAG (Directed Acyclic Graph).
05:10 Apache Airflow has different operators and executors which make task creation and execution easier.
 DAG with Dummy Operator in Airflow
 Apache Airflow allows you to manage DAGs and track their statuses in one place
 Airflow allows you to create complex pipelines and execute Python functions
 Airflow overview and recommended project

author: @saminyead1233
comment: Wow! The amount of value you bring to the viewer in just 12 minutes is just incredible! Like you were saying "the hassle of managing pipelines in python scripts", I made a data project a while back, and I really can understand what you mean. I heard that Airflow makes everything easier, but I kept deferring Airflow learning, partly because "maybe this is good for large data pipelines, but my one consists of just a few small tasks," and also because most YouTube videos of Airflow out there was a couple of hours long. And that's great if you are already committed to learn Airflow, but I was really looking for a video like yours - something that will give me a practical demo of how Airflow actually works, but it will be around 10-15 minutes. And this video was just perfect. Once again, thanks a whole lot! I'll definitely be integrating Airflow into my project now! And my resume too, God willing!

4:11 - In the context of DAG, “graph” is a data structure consisting of nodes & edges. It’s a mathematical field in itself. In the physical world, graphs can be seen as “networks” such as social network or transportation network. 

It’s should not be confused with graphs used for visualization such as bar graphs or line graphs.

video_title: What is Data Pipeline? | Why Is It So Popular?
author: @livestriming289
comment:
00:01 Data pipelines automate data collection, transformation, and delivery.
00:38 Data pipeline involves stages like collect, ingest, store, compute, and consume.
01:18 Data pipeline captures live data feeds for real-time tracking.
01:56 Data pipeline involves batch and stream processing of ingested data
 Data pipeline tools like Apache Flink and Google Cloud are used for real-time processing of data streams.
 Data is transformed for analysis in storage phase
 Data pipelines enable various end users to leverage data for predictive modeling and business intelligence tools.
 Data pipeline enables continuous learning and improvement using machine learning models.
Crafted by Merlin AI.

video_title: 코드 따라하기 - 1시간 안에 ELT 파이프라인 구축(dbt, Snowflake, Airflow)
author: Uploader(Desc)
comment:
How to build an ELT pipeline in 1 hour, using industry standard tools such as dbt, Snowflake and Airflow. This is a live coding tutorial, where I’ll walk you through the thinking process, and show you every step. We’ll cover basic data modeling techniques (fact tables, data marts), snowflake RBAC concepts, and how to orchestrate a dbt project using Airflow. Drop down in the comments section what Data Engineering topics you would like to see in the future!

Timestamps ⏰
0:00 - Intro
1:35 - Setup dbt + Snowflake
7:52 - Configure dbt_project.yml and packages
11:45 - Create source and staging tables
17:41 - Transformed models (fact tables, data marts)
20:25 - Macro functions
24:23 - Generic and singular tests
29:35 - Deploy models using Airflow

Live Coding notes 🎴
https://bittersweet-mall-f00.notion.s...

Who am I? 🙋🏻‍♂️
I'm Jay, I love making videos about travel, self-help and tech. I currently work in New York City as a data engineer, but I grew up in Malaysia and lived in the UK when I was 19. Back then, I had no idea what life was about, moving to so many places, navigating career in Tech. Today, I've learned a lot and wanna share my perspective through filmmaking.

Socials 📱
linkedin:   / jayzern  
insta:   / jayzern

comment:
dbt란 무엇일까요?

Fishtown Analytics(현 dbt Labs)에서 개발한 데이터 빌드 도구 또는 dbt는 데이터 분석가, 데이터 엔지니어, 분석 엔지니어가 추출-로드-변환 파이프라인에서 "변환" 단계를 실행할 수 있도록 지원합니다.

SQL로 변환을 작성하고 회사 데이터베이스에 대해 실행하면 됩니다.

"분석 엔지니어링 도구"라고도 불리는 dbt는 오픈 소스이며 많은 기업의 최신 데이터 스택에 필수적인 요소로 자리 잡았습니다. 또한 dbt를 중심으로 탄탄한 지원 커뮤니티가 형성되어 있습니다.

Snowflake, Databricks 또는 Bigquery와 같은 다른 데이터 플랫폼에 로드할 도구를 찾고 계신가요? Estuary를 사용해 보세요. 저는 Estuary와 파트너십을 맺기 전에 여러 고객에게 Estuary를 사용했는데, Estuary 덕분에 전체 프로세스가 훨씬 수월해졌습니다.
https://bit.ly/4eQC3oQ

이 영상이 마음에 드셨다면 다른 인기 영상도 확인해 보세요.

데이터 플랫폼이란 무엇이며 왜 구축해야 할까요?
   • What Is A Data Platform And Why You Should...  

최신 데이터 스택이란 무엇인가 - 데이터 인프라 소개 1부
   • What Is The Modern Data Stack - Intro To D...  

데이터 분야에 대한 최신 소식을 받아보시려면 여기에서 뉴스레터를 구독하세요.

https://seattledataguy.substack.com/

또는 제 블로그를 방문해 보세요.
https://www.theseattledataguy.com/

채널을 후원하고 싶으시다면 제 뉴스레터 유료 회원이 되실 수 있습니다.
https://seattledataguy.substack.com/s...

태그: 데이터 엔지니어링 프로젝트, 데이터 엔지니어 프로젝트 아이디어, 데이터 프로젝트 자료, 데이터 분석 프로젝트 자료, 데이터 프로젝트 포트폴리오

저에 대해:
저는 모든 형태의 데이터에 집중하며 경력을 쌓아 왔습니다. 사기 탐지, 환자 재입원 감소, 그리고 전반적인 의료비 절감을 위한 보험사 정책 재설계를 위한 알고리즘 개발에 집중해 왔습니다. 또한, 직원 및 예산과 같은 제한된 리소스를 최적화하기 위해 마케팅 및 IT 운영을 위한 분석 개발에도 참여했습니다. 저는 데이터 과학 및 엔지니어링 문제에 대해 Acheron Analytics라는 회사와 함께 또는 단독으로 개인 컨설팅을 제공합니다. 기술적인 문제를 직접 해결하고 리더십 팀의 데이터 활용 극대화 전략 수립을 지원한 경험도 있습니다.

*저는 제휴 프로그램에 참여하고 있으며, 링크 옆에 "*" 표시가 있는 경우 추가 비용 없이 수익의 일부를 받을 수 있습니다.

author: @TheElectrocar
comment: DBT was a game change for our tableau workbooks. Our tableau workbooks were taking sometimes up to 1-2 minutes to fully load. Once our data engineers added DBT to the mix, the tableau workbooks were taking 3-5 seconds to load. I am not fully sure how all this was done by our data engineers but it was straight up voodoo magic and our end users loved it. Bonus is it made us look good to our 3rd partners who said even their own data team's reports were taking minutes to fully load.

video_title: Apache Airflow One Shot- Building End To End ETL Pipeline Using AirFlow And Astro
author: Uploader(Desc)
comment:
Apache Airflow is an open-source workflow management platform for data engineering pipelines. It started at Airbnb in October 2014[2] as a solution to manage the company's increasingly complex workflows. Creating Airflow allowed Airbnb to programmatically author and schedule their workflows and monitor them via the built-in Airflow user interface

Code github: https://github.com/krishnaik06/ETLWea...

What is Data Pipeline | How to design Data Pipeline? - ETL vs Data pipeline

2) Google Cloud Platform Beginner Series (2020) -

3) Crunching Data Series (2020) -    • Learn - Data Engineering, Data Architectur...  

Hi Friends, I am Anshul Tiwari, and welcome to our youtube channel              I.T. k Funde.

More about this video -  
In this video, we will understand what is a data pipeline with the help of a real-life example. Data pipelines are designed to move data from one point to another. In this video, we will cover below topics -

1 - What is a Data Pipeline?
2 - Why you need a data pipeline?
3 - Basic design of a data pipeline
4 - Types of Data Pipeline - Batch, Streaming, Lambda architecture
5 -  Advanced data pipeline design

We will also learn about various products that can be used in a data pipeline - SAP BODS, Mongo DB, Apache Kafka, Big Query, MDM, Teradata, SAP Business Objects, Tableau.

author: @bigglesharrumpher4139
comment: Great video - it seems while technology has advanced, the concepts of batch loads and real-time data is actually decades old. Back in early 2000's we controlled all ETL and real-time loads with Unix or DOS or SQL scripts that provided return codes for success/failure which triggered alert emails, and we had KPI's for Data quality, backing-out jobs for failed loads, and many other control systems. It just seems there are more 'out-of-the-box' software to handle these now as opposed to custom-built solutions. Great presentation!

video_title: 초보자를 위한 데이터 엔지니어링 과정
author: Uploader(Desc)
comment:
Learn the essentials of data engineering in this course for beginners. You'll learn about Databases, Docker, and analytical engineering. You'll explore advanced topics like data pipeline building with Airflow, and engage in batch processing with Spark and streaming data with Kafka. The course culminates in a comprehensive project, putting your skills to the test in creating a full end-to-end pipeline. 

✏️ Justin Chau created this course. 

Course Resources: https://transparent-trout-f2f.notion....

Thanks to Airbyte for providing a grant to make this course possible.

❤️ Try interactive Databases courses we love, right in your browser: https://scrimba.com/freeCodeCamp-Data... (Made possible by a grant from our friends at Scrimba)


⭐️ Contents ⭐️
⌨️ (0:00:00) Introduction
⌨️ (0:00:36) Why Data Engineering
⌨️ (0:03:14) Docker
⌨️ (0:30:38) SQL
⌨️ (1:04:32) Building a Data Pipeline from Scratch
⌨️ (1:31:03) dbt
⌨️ (2:04:11) CRON Job
⌨️ (2:07:54) Airflow
⌨️ (2:41:14) Airbyte
⌨️ (3:01:54) Outro

author: @1001pepi
comment:
At 1:53:56 you may face an error due to the fact that the dbt service is launched before the completion of the elt_script service. 

To solve the issue, you have to add condition: service_completed_successfully under the depends_on clause of the dbt service to be sure that it will always be launched after the completion of the elt_script service.

코드: COMBO50을 입력하시면 50% 할인됩니다.

Airflow와 Python을 활용한 엔드투엔드 데이터 엔지니어링 프로젝트입니다. 이 프로젝트에서는 Twitter API를 사용하여 데이터를 추출하고, Python을 사용하여 데이터를 변환하고, Airflow/EC2에 코드를 배포하고, 최종 결과를 Amazon S3에 저장합니다.

프로젝트에 사용된 코드 및 명령 - https://github.com/darshilparmar/twit...

Elon Musk ruined the API part, you can use some other APIs

FAQ:

2. You need to request for V2 access: You will get an error but just by reading the doc you should be able to access Elevated Access

video_title: 10분 만에 Apache Airflow 배우기 | 데이터 엔지니어를 위한 고소득 기술
author: @vijayshreevaibhav
comment:
00:05 A data engineer builds data pipelines to extract, transform, and load data onto a target location.
01:50 Apache Airflow is a viral and widely adopted open-source project for managing data pipelines.
03:33 A workflow in Apache Airflow is called a DAG (Directed Acyclic Graph).
05:10 Apache Airflow has different operators and executors which make task creation and execution easier.
 DAG with Dummy Operator in Airflow
 Apache Airflow allows you to manage DAGs and track their statuses in one place
 Airflow allows you to create complex pipelines and execute Python functions
 Airflow overview and recommended project

author: @saminyead1233
comment: Wow! The amount of value you bring to the viewer in just 12 minutes is just incredible! Like you were saying "the hassle of managing pipelines in python scripts", I made a data project a while back, and I really can understand what you mean. I heard that Airflow makes everything easier, but I kept deferring Airflow learning, partly because "maybe this is good for large data pipelines, but my one consists of just a few small tasks," and also because most YouTube videos of Airflow out there was a couple of hours long. And that's great if you are already committed to learn Airflow, but I was really looking for a video like yours - something that will give me a practical demo of how Airflow actually works, but it will be around 10-15 minutes. And this video was just perfect. Once again, thanks a whole lot! I'll definitely be integrating Airflow into my project now! And my resume too, God willing!

4:11 - In the context of DAG, “graph” is a data structure consisting of nodes & edges. It’s a mathematical field in itself. In the physical world, graphs can be seen as “networks” such as social network or transportation network. 

It’s should not be confused with graphs used for visualization such as bar graphs or line graphs.

author: @livestriming289
comment:
00:01 Data pipelines automate data collection, transformation, and delivery.
00:38 Data pipeline involves stages like collect, ingest, store, compute, and consume.
01:18 Data pipeline captures live data feeds for real-time tracking.
01:56 Data pipeline involves batch and stream processing of ingested data
 Data pipeline tools like Apache Flink and Google Cloud are used for real-time processing of data streams.
 Data is transformed for analysis in storage phase
 Data pipelines enable various end users to leverage data for predictive modeling and business intelligence tools.
 Data pipeline enables continuous learning and improvement using machine learning models.
Crafted by Merlin AI.

video_title: 코드 따라하기 - 1시간 안에 ELT 파이프라인 구축(dbt, Snowflake, Airflow)
author: Uploader(Desc)
comment:
How to build an ELT pipeline in 1 hour, using industry standard tools such as dbt, Snowflake and Airflow. This is a live coding tutorial, where I’ll walk you through the thinking process, and show you every step. We’ll cover basic data modeling techniques (fact tables, data marts), snowflake RBAC concepts, and how to orchestrate a dbt project using Airflow. Drop down in the comments section what Data Engineering topics you would like to see in the future!

Timestamps ⏰
0:00 - Intro
1:35 - Setup dbt + Snowflake
7:52 - Configure dbt_project.yml and packages
11:45 - Create source and staging tables
17:41 - Transformed models (fact tables, data marts)
20:25 - Macro functions
24:23 - Generic and singular tests
29:35 - Deploy models using Airflow

Live Coding notes 🎴
https://bittersweet-mall-f00.notion.s...

Who am I? 🙋🏻‍♂️
I'm Jay, I love making videos about travel, self-help and tech. I currently work in New York City as a data engineer, but I grew up in Malaysia and lived in the UK when I was 19. Back then, I had no idea what life was about, moving to so many places, navigating career in Tech. Today, I've learned a lot and wanna share my perspective through filmmaking.

Socials 📱
linkedin:   / jayzern  
insta:   / jayzern

video_title: 실시간 데이터 스트리밍 | 엔드 투 엔드 데이터 엔지니어링 프로젝트
author: Uploader(Desc)
comment:
In this video, you will be building a real-time data streaming pipeline, covering each phase from data ingestion to processing and finally storage. We'll utilize a powerful stack of tools and technologies, including Apache Airflow, Python, Apache Kafka, Apache Zookeeper, Apache Spark, and Cassandra—all neatly containerized using Docker.

MORE FREE COURSES: https://datamasterylab.com

📚 What You'll Learn:
👉 Setting up a data pipeline with Apache Airflow
👉 Streaming data with Kafka and Kafka Connect
👉 Using Zookeeper for distributed synchronization
👉 Data processing with Apache Spark
👉 Data storage solutions with Cassandra and PostgreSQL
👉 Containerizing your data engineering environment with Docker

✨ Timestamps: ✨
0:00 Introduction
0:53 System architecture
3:47 Getting data from API with Airflow
17:10 Docker Compose for the architecture
26:09 Streaming data into Kafka
44:29 Apache Spark and Cassandra setup
49:33 Streaming data into cassandra
1:27:05 Outro

👦🏻 My Linkedin:   / yusuf-ganiyu-b90140107  
🚀 Twitter:   / yusufoganiyu  
📝 Medium:   / yusuf.ganiyu  

🌟 Please LIKE ❤️ and SUBSCRIBE for more AMAZING content! 🌟

Like this video? Buy me a coffee ❤️ https://www.buymeacoffee.com/yusuf.ga...

✅ Cassandra: https://cassandra.apache.org/
✅ Confluent Docs: https://docs.confluent.io/home/overvi...


✨ Tags ✨
Data Engineering, Apache Airflow, Kafka, Apache Spark, Cassandra, PostgreSQL, Zookeeper, Docker, Docker Compose, ETL Pipeline, Data Pipeline, Big Data, Streaming Data, Real-time Analytics, Kafka Connect, Spark Master, Spark Worker, Schema Registry, Control Center, Data Streaming
